Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: You absolutely can not beat this price. I ordered it on a Thursday and received it on Friday. The look is fantastic. Despite what others say about the brightness of the lights, I seem to think they are adequate. I haven't been able to use this yet for cooking as my range is backordered, but on the highest speed this baby seems to zoom. For $300 plus the charcoal inserts for $20, you really can't go wrong. Great Buy!

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Title: Z-Line provided dry wall screws to hang range hood!
Review_Text:
No kidding.  I got the outdoor model, and it included clear instrucitons to use the two dry wall screws to hang and support the whole range hood.

How ludicrous.  I can tell you where the rangehood would be if a slight wind blew.

I expected a framework to be included for solid install.  Nope.

Also the screws holes for the chimney flue are too large for the bolts they provided.

The range hood might be great -- but who cares if it falls off the wall or the wind blows it down the street.

I wouldn't recommend Z-line.

Can I give ZERO stars?

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Title: Great Product at a great price
Review_Text:
Ordered the hood a few months ago so I could make sure everything fit properly and the wiring would work properly.  Finally got it up and running a few weeks ago and it looks great.  Needed a few duct fittings to match our existing ducts, but it was fairly simple.

The hood looks great in our new kitchen and is a focal point.  Was going to buy one locally, but it had bad reviews and cost twice as much as this one.  The local one also didn't have the cool looking blue indicator lights on it.

Highly recommend it.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text:
The hood arrived quickly and very well packaged. I opened it up to check everything and was quite pleased with the quality of the product. I don't have this installed yet, so I will update my review after I get some use out of it.

edit:  I have had this installed for a few months now and still love it.  Very nice looking and
  and works like a champ. Not much else to say really, except that it's awesome!

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: Great looking vent for our updated kitchen. I shopped around and most items comparable were double the price. It shipped quickly and without a scratch on it.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Title: WOW! Proline series 4 level superior suction!
Review_Text:
4 count them, 4--button levels of air suction! Stainless Steel is not cheap but high grade & heavy thickness. My hood arrived in pristine condition & best packing I have EVER seen, so was well-pleased.

My 30" version of this unit has 3 removable Stainless Baffle sections which was FREE upgrade from aluminum screening, and the buttons are on the vertical front ledge of unit with a DIGITAL readout screen of the level of chosen suction and even has time-delay on shut-off = BONUS!

-Has a 3-prong plug to plug in and check if working the moment it arrived.
-The exit of the 6" round flu from motor has a butterfly damper that opens when fan engaged so will be great to prevent back flow from exterior.
-The two piece chimney surrounds are also heavy duty Stainless Steel and uppermost section has two sides consisting of a series of venting to dispel heat at top sides.
-The entire hood and two sections are protected by a clear or blue skin of plastic that is easily removed after installation.
-There is an included small approximately 2"X3" clear plastic topless box that has slots that slide into brackets under motor housing that is supposed to catch any accumulating grease from motor area low point that is accessed via the removable baffle. This then can be emptied and wiped clean with ease.
-Installation is easily done & straightforward...find the centerpoint of stovetop/range and have center of hood match this point and mark two hanger holes at level into studs with provided heavy gauge screws (rip open wall & install stud if not there--molly screws are NOT going to work here--after all won't be seen anyway as hood covers it).

Con:
-Two halogen lights are in rear of unit and are only 20 Watt each so total 40Watt so woefully dim for cooking surface...I have upper cabinets on both sides so I am installing under cabinet lights on both sides to compensate.

I have not permanently installed totally on wall yet as am doing some extension of wiring in wall behind hood in wall but will update when totally complete with photos. I am using the two baffles on interior two exits of blower motor but I am doing a hollow faux wood beam to cover the metal 6" flu system across the room to vent through out through bump-out dinette roof.

This hood totally blows away the competition at Lowe's or HomeDepot stores...and the price is at least $100-400 BELOW comps with these features anywhere online.

Recommend this product.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text:
This product is comparable to ones sold at Lowes and Home Depot by manufacturer Broan.  One like this retailed for around $449 and is special order a most stores and takes about 14 days to arrive.  I ordered the Z Line on Friday and it was was at my door the following Thursday and saved $150 dollars on the product and free shipping.

The product is super well made and very easy to install.  The two hole mount and pigtail make this easier than an under cabinet model to install. I was not a fan of the instruction book but I would take bad instructions over a good product any day.

I would recommend this to everyone who want a high end look to your kitchen at a fraction of the cost.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: I'm always worried about ordering bigger purchases online since you can't always tell the quality (especially with metal work) from photos online. But this unit, exceeded all of my expectations. It is top notch metal and design. Also I was surprised to find out that the vents facing the stove look like the cool commercial style vents that usually cost a lot more. Also shipping time was super fast and it was well packaged/secured in the box. Install was easy and the timed shut off feature is fantastic. Thumbs up all around from me and my fiancee.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: I paid $299 for this range hood!  Why would anyone pay more?  I just received the unit today and unpacked it as soon as it came in the door.  I am going to do a kitchen remodel in 4 months and I'm getting all my supplies lined up way ahead in case something is wrong or doesn't work right.  I set this hood on my kitchen table and plugged it in to test the noise level(because they don't tell you on the page what the dba/sones are for the product in use).  This is a VERY QUIET MACHINE and the cubic feet per minute(cfm) is excellent.  With 4 speed levels and adjustable lights, they tilt back and forth, this exhaust hood rivals all that I've looked at.  I've been all over the web and to about 7 stores checking out range hoods and this one is as good as it gets, AND THE PRICE MAKES IT THE BEST DEAL!  If your looking to redo your kitchen or replace an existing hood, this model rocks.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text:
This unit is very clean and nice looking.  However the instructions were pretty much usless.  The first page simply said, "find middle point and measure out from there."  Not telling how much to measure or how high unit is.
Works and looks great though.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: Very nice range hood.  Looks perfect.  Good fan, and not too loud (though you can hear it for sure).  The lights are great - they swivel to point where you want them to.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: This hood is great. It has a nice look to it and is very effective. I just applied three coat of seasoning to a new carbon steel wok, which generated a ton of smoke. This hood didn't skip a beat. There was no smoke buil up in the kitchen.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: great and good quality

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: Works as expected. time will tell as to how long it last.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)

Review_Text: looks fabulous, installs easily. Very powerful fan, we only run it on 1, never on 2, 3, or 4.

Highest setting is so loud we need can barely talk to each other.  Very, very disappointed that this just doesn't handle it's primary function.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Title: I'll look elsewhere for a better product. Bottom line
Review_Text: Box came with one strip of tattered tape keeping it from opening/falling apart. Inside, the box was missing instructions and the installation kit - making me wonder if someone did open the box to look inside and perhaps forgot to put back the missing accessories. In addition, the chimney, which came as two pieces (a surprise to me from looking at the picture) was painted white, not stainless steel. Finally, several key parts were cheap plastic. Not really the product I expected from reading the reviews. I immediately taped the box closed and notified Amazon that I am returning it for a refund. I'll look elsewhere for a better product. Bottom line, the product looks better in the picture than in reality. Buyer beware.

The new one does seem to run fine and the dent is on the side/back so not to noticeable.  Overall,  very happy with Amazon.  Not happy with Z line customer service

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Title: Does not have LED lights as described.
Review_Text: A very attractive hood.  Easy to install.  Fairly quiet.  The product description is incorrect when it says: "2-Watt to 3-Watt NEW ADJUSTABLE LED Lights".  The lights are halogen (M11- 20watt).  One burned out the first month after I installed it.  I was disappointed to have to deal with expensive halogen bulbs that do not last very long when I was expecting LED's.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Title: Don't know if I like it because Amazon Home Services left me hanging!!!
Review_Text:
I don't know if I like this or not because at checkout I chose Amazon Home Service for installation.  I was hesitant to do so but all of my Amazon experiences have been positive so I figured that they use contractors and installation professionals that have proven to be reliable, properly insured, etc.  I was asked at checkout if this was replacing an existing vent hood or was this a brand new installation requiring duct work to be run.  I chose "brand new installation" as my prior over the range microwave was recirculating only, not ducted to the outside.
My install was scheduled for a Friday.  I took the day off work.  As the end of the appointment window drew near and still no contractor, the contractor called to say that they would be late.  She also asked if the crew would have access to the attic.  I explained that I live in a two story house, the ductwork wouldn't be run through the attic, it would have to be vented out the side of the house.  Three hours later she called back to say they would have to reschedule for the next day at 9:00 am.  On Saturday I cancelled two other personal appointments so that I could wait for the contractor.  When they showed up they were very confused that there was no duct.  They called their supervisor, the same woman I had three conversations with already, and put me on the phone with her.  She said that they could not do the work because there was no duct and running a duct required a permit.  I asked her if they could pull a permit on Monday and reschedule and she said no, the homeowner is supposed to get the permit ahead of time and they don't pull permits.  I asked her if I got a permit would they come back and she said no, they don't do permit work. I told her that in all the work I have ever had done to my house, I had never been asked by a contractor to pull my own permit.  We ended the conversation.  I jumped online to my City's website and they don't require a permit.  The website also stated they only issue permits to the contractor performing the work, not to homeowners unless the homeowner was completing the work themselves.  I looked at several neighboring city's websites and they said much the same.  So apparently this contractor doesn't really know what they are talking about or what they are doing.  I assumed that Amazon would have vetted the contractors they use.  I cannot believe that Amazon is letting their brand be tarnished by incompetent contractors.  For all I know this contractor isn't even properly insured.  NEVER NEVER NEVER again will I trust Amazon Home Services and I will tell everyone to steer clear.  I'm currently looking for a contractor and if push comes to shove, I will buy a six inch hole saw and do it myself.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Title: Good for short drop celings , Love it.
Review_Text:
I Love it. I bought this to replace my ugly under cabinet hood in my old outdated kitchen. . I took the cabinet out that had 4 simple screws. I have a real short drop ceiling and was told this would not fit. I even called Zline and they were not sure it would fit and actually sugested another model. Well its simple, i just cut the chimney length, the chimney was cut to 6 inches and i still have the proper clearance to the stove as per the manufacture and Zline. I also installed the optional crown molding so your cut on the chimney does not have to be perfect, the molding hides it. I easily installed this myself.  Here is a picture incase im not making my self clear.

Cons: Lights are hot to the touch and not very bright

However, the grease traps are a bit flimsy and tedious to put back because there are these tabs that hold them up which get stuck and you have to push the two layers back together for the tabs to pop back out to lock it into the hood range.

Review_Text:
The unit arrived in good condition, considering it was a reduced price due to outside packaging damage. There was one screw missing to hold the glass canopy. The only problem with those units is the stainless steel exhaust cover. Instead of having the base unit 20" long, both units come in 16" and when assembled it amounts to 31" total lengths from top of unit to ceiling. In my case the height was borderline and left me with a maximum hood height to the range distance.
Noise level at range 1 is adequate with increasing noise on level 2,3 and 4.

Review_Text: This product is really a good one and it keep my kitchen so nice and great in temperature using this ventilator.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Title: Possibly quite a bargain, but inspect it carefully.
Review_Text:
The description of the item I purchased was "Used - Very Good - Item has no cosmetic scratches or blemishes. Item has no cracks or dents. Item will come in original packaging. Packaging will be damaged."  Unfortunately, since the packaging was not damaged, I did not closely inspect the item until it was time for installation in my kitchen.  As it turns out, there were a host of problems including loose parts within the hood (the power transformer, was supposed to be held in place by two screw/nut combos, and was just floating loose), and a big corner dent on the back left corner that I was able to flatten sufficiently to install the item.

The fan is wonderful and quite quiet for the amount of air it moves.  Installation was pretty straightforward, but the instructions are not that helpful.  For instance, the baffles remove by sliding the little knobs backward and the front of the baffle then drops down.  I was fooled because there is a little knob at the front that looks like it unscrews, and there is a handle at the back that looks like something you would pull on.  The manual also describes a "grease cup", but it's a rectangular piece of clear plastic that would be overflowing if you stacked five quarters in it - not "cup" shaped and certainly doesn't look like it will hold much grease.

Bottom line - if you buy one of these, inspect it very carefully when you receive it.  There was no indication from the box / packaging that this had pretty obviously been dropped on one corner.  I know I learned my lesson.  If you get a good'un, you will have scored a bargain.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Title: Great price on a powerful, well designed range hood.
Review_Text:
Overall it's does take more time than expected to install (does take two people), and the directions leave a little more to be desired. But this is probably the case with all range hoods.

This is a single fan, 760 CFM unit that offers 4 fan speeds, two halogen lights in back, and a timer feature to turn off the fans. A few nice points are that the look is very "gourmet" with the vents and handles for the grease traps, the lights tip so that they can be adjusted to point at the food or reflect off the back splash, and the buttons are very simple. It also comes with two nice long, nested pieces of vent shaft for high ceilings.

Here's some tips:
1) you'll need duct tape, and possibly more ducting depending on your application. It comes with a fairly long duct already though.
2) really measure out how tall you're going to position the range hood, keeping in consideration not just the height above the cooktop, but also the vent shaft too. Too low, and there may not be enough shaft. Too tall, and you may not be able to mount the shaft using the predrilled holes.
3) plan out where your outlet will be... the duct and mount on the fan are very close to the back wall, so make sure the outlet / power cord can clear it.

I did find the ceiling mount for the vent shaft to be too short for easy assembly. Unless you're trimming around the shaft, you'll need that bracket all the way up where the wall meets the ceiling, leaving very little room for you to screw in the shaft to the mount.

Finally, the fan speeds are great - lowest setting is still strong, yet quiet; and the max setting is powerful. Fan is mounted in the range well because I didn't experience any vibration.

I did have to re-connect the button controls to the main power connector before operation. It didn't turn on, so I had to troubleshoot the issue - luckily wiring is exposed and not hard to figure out.

Review_Title: Great for looks not quiet at all.
Review_Text: While upgrading my kitchen with new cabinets, fresh paint and removing an under cabinet range I decided to go with this wall mount range mostly for the price and it seemed great at the time. After seeing mixed reviews I decided to go ahead and purchase it. I had it stored away for a lil over a month while the cabinets and paint work was completed I finally had it installed and I can definitely say I love the way it looks and the upgraded led daylight bulbs that were included looked really nice. Unfortunately my issue is the loudness even just on the first exhaust setting. It sounds loud since the wall where it is mounted on is actually the same division wall for a hallway and you can literally hear the walls shake and a loud roaring echo. I dared trying it on the highest setting and no lie it sounds like an army helicopter is landing on the roof of my home. Wow!! I most definetly would never go past the lowest setting. I purchased some rubber style washers to place them between the wall and back of the range where the screws go in to secure it and just did not do the trick so I guess im out of luck and am going to have to live with it since I have had it stored for that whole month and paid to have it installed.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Title: It's beautiful however, I don't feel like it sucks up ...
Review_Text:
We installed this oven hood about 2 years ago. It's beautiful however, I don't feel like it sucks up as much smoke and grease as it should. We still need to open doors and windows to air out any food smells and smoke that comes from cooking.
Also, we cook almost every day so the grates need to be cleaned on a regular basis. Otherwise grease collects in the grates and then will drip back onto the stovetop below. It's gross. It's incredible hard to clean as well.
That being said, it's not bad for the price. If we were to do it again, we may spend a little more to get a more effective product just because of how much we use our kitchen. If you don't cook as frequently then this oven hood would be a great option.

Installation was not hard but since our studs did not line up with the mounting holes after using anchors and mounting with existing holes we drilled into studs in other locations - the anchor bolts we used were rated for more than the weight of it but just would rather some part of it is attached through a stud. I did replace the plastic vent with a metal one from home depot because I just preferred not to have plastic in the chimney stack. The lights are very bright and fan works quite well although I have yet to use it on the highest setting. I absolutely love the look and function of it. The entire thing came covered in white plastic so while installing we did not have to worry about scratching it that was a definite plus. The buttons are simple just push what you need and it comes on or turns off.

Review_Title: Great range hood - very powerful and quiet
Review_Text: We bought this range hood for our newly remodeled kitchen last year.  After using it a full year, I am very pleased with it.  It has held up very well and we haven't had one problem with this unit yet.  The light bulb has lasted the entire time without a replacement and we even leave it on at night often. Funny story; (tldr - easy enough I ordered it in my sleep) We'd been looking for a range hood for about a month with no real luck. I got an email at 3:30am from Amazon promoting this one on sale. I didn't have my phone on silent so the notification woke me up. I look at it, liked the specs and was trying to figure out if it would ship to Canada. Only way to know for sure is add it to my cart and take it all the way to the last step before hitting submit order. I found out it did and was planning on sending it to my wife to see what she thought in the morning. So I turn my phone on silent and go back to sleep. Wake up at 7:00 and see an order conf email from Amazon in my inbox. Lucky the specs check out and the Mrs like it.

Of all the stuff we've bought for our reno, this was the easiest lol!

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text:
I think it works pretty well. We had some "resonance" issues when we first installed it, because it moves some serious air. It turns out that I needed to reinforce the ten foot high wall it was installed on, and then the booming sound went away. I cannot tell the difference between "3" and "4" (except noise level), but I definitely can tell the difference between "1," "2," and "3."

The grease traps work very well, and clean up easily. The lights work well *IF* you are careful not to cut yourself on the sheetmetal when changing bulbs, like I did the first time. (We are trying out LEDs for longer service life, we hope.)

The one minor annoyance (for me) is that I have to push the "off/on" button too many times. First push activates a three minute timer, which we never use. Second push actually turns of the fan. Then, there is the third push that activates the fan speed buttons, but doesn't start anything. So, when turning it off I push the button three times, so I can just push one button to start the fan next time.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Title: Installing: What you need to know
Review_Text:
Installing can be a pain unless you do a few things - 1.) do not use those cheesy fasteners to hook it to the wall.  Cut out the wall and install a 1/2" piece of plywood to the studs to attach the zlkb36 to.  Takes more time, but you don't have to worry about it crashing down. 2.) "Optional" cut the plug off and use  a low profile plug.  YOU can get it at home depot as a short extension cord.  I did this because things were a little tight when I wired in the electrical in the wall. 3.) Installing the stack must begin at the top and you should use masking tape to keep it from telescoping back to the bottom.  Also - the screws they give you are about 1/4" long and are a royal pain to get started... but if you use those longer electrical screws for outlets - you will find the threads are the same and much easier to get started.

Great range hood!  I love it.

Review_Text: I installed this unit in July 2014.  It looked and worked great.  The vent function was really good.  In January 2015, one of the lights quit working.  I replaced the bulb with the same type and it worked for about four days.  Then both lights quit working.  I replaced both bulbs but the lights would not illuminate.  I have tried to find a replacement transformer, but no repair shops in my town have heard of this unit.  I can't find anything on the internet and the manufacturer does not answer the phone and Amazon doesn't appear interested.  Folks, if the manufacturer doesn't support their product and is indifferent to their customers, you should avoid this company at all costs.  American products cost more, no doubt they are made in China like this one, but at least you can get parts.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text:
We love this range hood.  It looks awesome, the suction is very good, it's quiet, and the lighting is great.  Initially, I had purchased another range hood with led lights, but they were dim and the color temperature was too cool for illuminating food nicely.  While the halogen bulbs are warm and will have to be replaced at some point in the future, they are very bright, the color temperature is perfect, and I love that they are adjustable.
Installation was a bit tricky since we have masonry walls, and the protective film was difficult to remove from the top of the hood once installed (as another reviewer mentioned).  But now that it's up, it looks great and we are very happy with it.  The seam between the two telescoping duct covers is not terribly noticeable, which I like.  I haven't cooked anything with a lot of smoke yet, but when it's on, you can actually see little particles of dust being sucked up into the hood.
Also, the packaging was very good and there were no dents or scratches when it arrived.  I highly recommend this range hood.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text:
This is a budget fan ONLY for those who CANNOT spend a couple hundred more. It looks beautiful and functions decently, but that is all I can say that is positive. The cons:
1. NOISY!! Even at lowest speed, too loud. Speed, 2, 3 or 4...get out your hearing protection
2. LOW FLOW. Speed one, which is what I am forced to use because it is the only speed quiet enough to hear myself think, is useful only if the pot or pan is in the back of the stove and the steam or smoke is forced to collect under the hood. It won't pull smoke or steam into it from the front of the stove which just barely juts out past the edge of the hood. Speed four is the best at pulling smoke or steam, but really, you can't even talk to anyone else in the kitchen with that amount of noise.
3. LIGHTS BURN OUT MONTHLY. I can't figure this one out, but I'm replacing a light a month.

I would not buy again, I would spend several hundred extra dollars just to get a quieter fan.

Unit is sturdy and has a timer in case you don't want to remember to turn it off. Two little halogen lights give plenty of light over the cooktop. Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Title: It looks good, clears away all cooking smells and even better
Review_Text: We cook a lot, and this little sucker, ahem, really keeps up.  It looks good, clears away all cooking smells and even better, Z-Lines customer service is amazing!  We've had a couple very small little things come up, and the customer service team got right on it and resolved our questions immediately.  We would buy this again and plan to use this for many years to come!

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: The only tricky part about the installation was that my ceiling was too low to assemble the rectangular duct cover as it was. I had to cut both sections in half to be able to fit in my eight foot kitchen with soffit. This would be perfect for someone with high ceilings. Well made and works great, but not everyone has a high speed cut off wheel.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Title: Needs a re-design of the power connection
Review_Text: My only beef with the design is that it should be designed to hard wired to the power source instead of a standard wall outlet plug. So because there was no accommodation inside the cabinet with an electrical box, our electrician wired an outlet right inside the stack area which made it necessary to route the vent pipe around the plug. Not a clean install. It also prevented me from using rigid steel ducting for the exhaust. So right above the actual outlet for the range hood, the flexible accordion style (plastic - flammable - melt-able)pipe makes a jog around the plug. You think that's going to become a grease trap? I do. That is the only reason I did not give it a 5 star review. The unit functions perfectly and is a very sleek and clean design. I really like its appearance and function. I have ordered some MR11 LED bulbs for the illumination. The halogen lamps are certainly ample but I like the benefit of the low power consumption of the LED lamps. My wife leaves them on all the time because it looks nicer with them on.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text:
Couldn't write a product review for several months because I was having a kitchen remodel and it takes some time. Am happy to report that this is a handsome hood and works very well for me. After reading other reviews, I was concerned about the expandable plastic pipe that extends to the ceiling, but the remodelers weren't worried and that's enough for me. (The plastic pipe is covered with a stainless steel extension. The hood actually hangs from hooks on the wall.)

It would be tough to install this yourself because the hardest part of the installation is running the pipe through the attic and attaching it to a vent in the roof.

The hood has four speeds, one of which you should not need. It also has two lights on the back that give a lot of illumination.

I wouldn't hesitate to buy this again.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: This thing is amazing.  The LED light is nice. Cleaning is easy. Power beautifully variable.  Not expensive for what you get. Best kitchen buy I think I have ever made.

Review_Text: I cook a lot of Chinese stir fry and oily/smokey foods like bacon. At full power on the hood, I still get my smoke alarm going off. Granted, my burners are pretty powerful, but I even was just searing some steaks the other day and the smoke alarm went off. It's way better than a recirculating type or a microwave/fan combo, but it still leaves much to be desired. Next time I will save up and just get a nicer unit.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)

Review_Title: Very nice hood. The metal punched metal is sharp
Review_Text: Very nice hood. The metal punched metal is sharp, when installing use a good pair of gloves and long sleeves. It's not stainless steel, magnets stick to it. I vaguely don't like that you have to push two buttons to turn it on, but not a big deal. It would be a no-brainer if it had LED lights, the 1980's halogens are a bit dim. The turn off in 3 minutes feature is very nice. I don't know where this plastic cover goes.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Title: High-end looking and performing range hood at a budget price
Review_Text: We bought this for our new hew house. It looks great! It provides that high-end gourmet kitchen look at a very reasonable price. The lights are bright and the fan is powerful. It sucks air with much more force than a standard range fan kit. This is great because I was concerned that at this price range I would be getting a professional LOOKING fan, but that did not perform to the same level. My concern has been alleviated-- this thing is great. The true test was frying bacon in a pan, which normally leaves a very strong odor lingering. With the fan running, I could not smell the bacon cooking just a foot away from the stove, and there was no lingering scent afterwards. I did go outside near the vent, and I could smell the bacon odor being pulled outside which is how it should work-- it smelled like i was walking next to a Waffle House. Another nice feature, in my opinion, is that coincidentally the blue LED display matches the blue LED display of our other appliances.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: I recently purchased this range hood for my kitchen remodel, Quality is outstanding for the price, and comparable to units costing double and even triple what I paid. Haven't needed to clean it yet, but playing around with it, it seems pretty simple. Also the grille is dishwasher safe. Received within 2 days of purchase (not using prime, but regular shipping). Would definitely recommend to anyone going for a modern look in their kitchen without paying an outrageous price

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: Buena compra

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: Looks wonderful installed.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text:
The price and look of the product is compelling and it is what drew me in to purchase it via Sears.  So when my handyman got it up and running I was a little apprehensive that it may not be all its supposed to be in terms of CFM, looks, etc.  Thankfully all my fears were unfounded.  It has been an exceptional product in every respect.

There are four levels of fan, the highest of which is necessary only for high-heat meat searing and tings like popcorn.  In all instances, partially due to having only one 90 degree bend in the exhausting plan, it has worked to perfection.  I find it amusing to smell the minimal odors indoors and then go outside to smell what seems to be a restaurant in my side-yard!

The service has also been stellar. One of the two halogen bulbs went out a few months into my purchase.  I called Z-line direct to get replacements.  They were able to pull up my Sears order in an instant, noted the model and that it was a recent purchase, and sent two new LED bulbs to me free of charge.
