Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Title: No way this 760CFM; It's probably 300CFM max
Review_Text:
The only thing I can say good about this range hood is its look. It looks pretty neat for the money. I really could not find anything that looks better than this for the money.

I purchased this range hood to replace my current range hood (which is rated at 500CFM) mostly because Z-Line says the range hood is 760CFM in its product description. If that was true, it would be a good deal for the price (I paid $300). But the amount of air this range hood actually pushes out at exhausted vent when running at it max speed is much smaller than my old range hood does. I don't have an air flow meter to get an accurate number, but looking at how much the flap on the vent opens and feeling the air stream blown out when running this range hood at is max v.s. when running my old range hood, I would estimate this range hood is 300CFM max.

Other than that misleading description, this range hood has several other flaws:

- The exhausted pipe come with the range hood is plastic. This is not good. All exhausted pipe for range hood should be rigid steel pipe. It's not a big deal for me as I simply not used it, and used a metal pipe instead.

- The pipe adapter between the hood canopy and the round pipe is also plastic. This caused an headache for me. I couldn't find an steel adapter that fits the range hood from any store. So I had to spend many hours to build an adapter using a piece of 8-in diameter round metal pipe to replace the plastic one on this range hood.

- The design  and build of this range hood makes it's very hard and dangerous to do regular cleaning for the inside:

  + Inside this range hood's canopy, metal edges are not smoothed out. They are extremely sharp. That makes cleaning inside this range hood is a dangerous. I got several cuts on my hands when trying to do that.

  + The edges of baffle filters have the same issue, they are sharp. I plan to give them some sanding job to fix this issue.

  + There are many small chambers inside the range hood canopy. It's practically impossible to have a good cleaning for those chambers. In my experience with range hoods, if not cleaned properly, after using for sometime (years), the cheesy will accumulate enough and start dripping out on things being cooked on the stoves below! I tried to mitigate this with aluminum duct tape (the thing used for heating pipes). Using aluminum duct tape, I could seal/cover most of those chambers so that the cheesy stuff won't get inside them.

  + Many parts, wires inside the range hood canopy are exposed to the air stream the hood tries to suck out. It takes much more time to clean those. They should have been covered, not exposed to the air stream, so that we don't have to clean them.

I'm still using this range hood, not returning it even with all those issues because I damaged my old range hood canopy when taking it out. I need something to fill that old range hood's place! I'm planning to salvage the old blower and throw away this range hood weak blower to 'fix' the capacity issue.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: Very nice range hood/great quality for the money.  I had planned to pay $200 more for the same type of hood.  The hood arrived on the day it was promised and my handyman did not have any issues installing it.  Other reviews on this item stated that the exhaust fan is loud and the lights are a little bright...and that is true, but I am not a cook and will probably rarely use the exhaust/or lights.  I just wanted this look for my kitchen and I am thrilled about my purchase!

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Title: Excellent for the price, with a few annoyances.
Review_Text:
I used this to replace an over-range microwave that didn't work properly and had a fan that produced more noise than airflow. I shopped all over, and this was half the price or less of competitive products. I just finished installing it today, used it while cooking dinner this evening, and thus far I'm pretty happy with it. I'd say it looks comparable to some of the $1000 range hoods I looked at. I have a few minor nits, but nothing that would make me want to spend twice as much.

The good:
- Nice overall look and material quality. Looks excellent installed.
- The unit itself is easy to install.
- Buttons operate well. LED indicator on the front is nice.
- Lights work well and can be rotated to focus on the cooking surface.
- good fan suction even at low speed.
- Well packaged. The finished surfaces are covered with a cling plastic to protect them from damage. This is nice on the primary unit, more annoying to peal off of the baffles.

Things to be aware of:
- The baffles fit very loosely into the housing and sit a little lop-sided. I'm sure this can be rectified with a little creativity.
- A little louder than I expected, but still ok for having a conversation at the low speed without having to speak up.
- The unit tended to vibrate when hanging on two bolts. I had to put a couple additional screws through the back corners to hold it firmly against the wall to address that.
- Don't bother with the included wall screws and anchors, or the plastic duct. Do yourself a favor and get the right parts for your installation from a hardware store.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: Has anyone replaced the two halogen light bulbs? I can't seem to figure them out... Any insight would be appreciated.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: This hood was received as advertised: sleek, easy to install, and powerful.  The 4 speed controls are nice and not found on other brands.  I would recomend this hood to anyone.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: This a revision of my previous review.  I haven't opened the box for the range hood yet but Laureen at Z line was so helpful in following up with the order status.  not sure what happened exactly with the previous shipment but when I asked where the hood was and that the tracking # was useless, she followed up right away and sent a 2 day delivery.  it just arrived and I can't express how impressed I am with the Z line customer service.  I hope the hood is just as impressive.  Nice to see a company who actually cares.  This will complete the kitchen remodel.  Thank you Z line and thank you Laureen.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)

The chimney was too long for my kitchen so I contacted the seller through email and after back and forth emails for a few days I got shorter chimney pieces.  I ended up having my husband combine one piece from the long chimney and one from the short.  It all worked out and it looks so great.  It works great too.  It blows a lot of air and I love the lights.  So happy with this purchase.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: This range hood is so cool. Renovating the kitchen (walls, range, floors, counter tops, some cabinets) lots of stainless and brushed nickel. This range hood is classy but unique looking. Very functionsl, lots of light, the controls are easily accessed, just discovered the three minute delay on shutting off fan. Of course you can hear the fan when running, but not bad, I've had much louder ones. Exhausts well. Really like this unit, fits in nicely with the look I'm working for. Installation wasn't bad, but we had rebuilt that wall and put in extra cross-bracing for this type of hood, don't know that that was necessary, but I don't worry about it coming loose or vibrating.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Title: good quality at a great price
Review_Text: I needed a strong range hood exhaust fan but did not want to spend $1000+  then I saw the Z line 30" SS hood W/ Baffle filters.  This hood comes packaged very well. It went up in no time and runs great. Cooking smells don't go into the rest of my house now even with the kitchen door open.  I like the 4 speed fan, the under mounted halogen lights and the fact that the fan shut off can be timed.  I vented this hood outside using a Broan vented end cap with damper and bug/bird screen #940.  Both work great together I just hope it keeps the cold air out in the winter too.  Don't get me wrong this is not a designer style hood which you would spend big bucks for but it's going to do the job you bought it for!  Buy it you'll be happy!

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: This product is much better than anything else on the market for the price. Price point is fantastic and operation is fantastic... easy to install with great instructions would give it a 10 on a scale of 10 ,10 being high.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)

I had looked at models with bolder LED read outs, $ 150.00 dollars more but I was concerned with power surges knocking out the circuit board. You need to be careful with the vent stack it can scratch easily. It isn't quite. The two 20 watt lights in the back bottom of the unit are bright and swivel nice.  We have had the unit for  a month now and very pleased. I have always had great experience with Amazon.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: We took a chance on this hood after looking at quite a few. This style runs easily 50% more than the price here, and we were a little skeptical, but after getting my hands on it - it's as good or better than $700 hoods we saw in showrooms. The fan is a bit noisy, but it also moves more air than most of the other hoods we looked at. The lights are great, the install kit is very nice. All in all, zero complaints with this part.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: We had looked at various stores and online for a range hood to install in our re-modelled kitchen, but all of them were much more expensive than the one we found and bought on Amazon, the "Z Line 36" Wall Mount *Pro Seris*. When we received and checked the shipment after it arrived, it seemed to be exactly as described. But, we have not had it installed yet, as our kitchen is still in process. The contractor recently checked out all the parts and decided to buy a metal exhaust duct to replace the plastic one that is included in the original package. Otherwise, it seems like it will be nice for what we need it for. The stainless seems a little lightweight, but it does match our other stainless steel appliances.

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text:
We could not be more pleased with how quickly the hood arrived and how well packaged it was.  We are in the middle of kitchen remodeling and we had to wait a while until the cabinets were in place in order to install it.

I won't talk about the process of installation because everyone has different needs, for instance, venting issues, re-routing of air pipes, holes in ceiling or wall, etc.

The Hood looks amazing but the most important thing is that it works as intended. It does.

The picture shown on the description is not the same one we got. Ours is all stainless steel with steel baffles. 760 CFM's.  We were able to install it at 32" from the top of the high power gas stove and it works beautifully without getting in the way. (for those with high BTU gas stoves, do the research for your stove since high BTUs and high CFMs may need extra distance)

We specially enjoy the fact that the hood can be set up to shut itself off after 3 minutes.

It is a bit loud, but not as loud as the piece of junk it replaced with less than 300 CFMs. We have kitchen/family room combo and there is enough noise with TV and kids to make no difference. The main thing is that it contains cooking odors and there is no grease on the side cabinets.

After cooking a dish with cabbage as one of the ingredients, we could all tell how much better this hood was than the one we had before. It did not smell in the bedrooms or hallway.

In short, we love the hood. It looks great. The stainless steel is beautifully polished and is eye candy as well as a great performer.

One thing to remind myself of and leaving it here for those who will find it useful: When cleaning the baffles, remember to remove and wash the capture plastic container.

Okay, how is the service with this company?

If you have to deal with anyone there, you may be pleasantly surprised with the fact that your call is not routed out of the country.  My contact person was Laureen in Ohio and she could not have been more friendly and professional.

The fast responses received from Laureen is reminiscent of times gone by. If you are old enough, you will remember when customer service, professionalism, courtesy, and problem solving, were the golden standard upon which businesses were built. This is most definitely the case here.

Our reason for the contacts is the fact that our ceilings are 10' feet tall. If that is the case for you, ensure that you order the right extensions to fit your needs at the time of placing the order.

We could not be more pleased with the product or the company. We highly recommend them.

In response to someone complaining about the screws: We used our own to install the hood based on the location of our studs and size of holes that had to be drilled. It is not a big problem or a reason to downgrade the quality of the product.

(As soon as I know how to insert a picture of the installed hood, I will)

Product_Name: ZLINE 36" Convertible Vent Wall Mount Range Hood in Stainless Steel (KB-36)
Review_Text: The hood looks and works well.  For the money you can't ask for more.  Aside from looks it works really well keeping the noise level very low.  Easy to install and very light.  Is great.

Review_Text: Shipment was pretty fast. The glass can intact upon arrival. My husband set it up pretty easy. I love how it compliments my kitchen and wouldnt have made anyother choice for the price !!! Will admit that on the 4th setting it is a bit loud but I don't mind because it does the job!!!!

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Works reasonably well.  Would have been 5 stars if it had been wider to match the width of the vent, but as it is it redirects most of the air.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: We have a large chest of drawers sitting over our heat vent in our bedroom, and it was blocking the majority of our heat and leaving the bedroom freezing!  We did quite a bit of shopping around for a product like this, and based on reviews, they all seemed flimsy and worthless.  So I suppose we bought this with lowered expectations, but it's doing the job we needed it to do!  The room is significantly warmer.  A good indicator was that the clothes in our bottom drawer were always warm like they were just out of the dryer, but they aren't nearly as warm anymore, indicating that the heat is definitely being deflected out from underneath the dresser.  It did come with just one clip, so the sides of the vent extender are not secured, and I imagine we are losing some heat from the sides when the air kicks on and blows it up a bit, but overall it has improved our frigid situation!  I agree that it is definitely over-priced, but with shipping and handling, buying a product like this from any site ran about the same amount.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: This vent deflector is overpriced and made of flimsy plastic but it does what it is designed to do.  I use it underneath a sofa and it does a good job of diverting the air from the floor vent underneath to the middle of the room.  The deflector is approximately 1 1/2 inches tall so it should fit easily under most sofas.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: I was trying to replace vent covers that redirected air that became misplaced after a fire. This vent cover is huge and obtrusive and I can't use it. I am still trying to find the ones I had before.

Review_Title: Keeps the cats from sleeping on the vent.
Review_Text: Perfect for under the couch.  Keeps the cats from sleeping on the vent.  Now they sleep in front of the deflector.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: We have a heat register centered under a set of drawers in our kitchen. It's a gaping hole in the floor that we can't access without cutting a hole in bottom of the drawer cabinet. The register cover is about a foot in front of the register in the kickboard. Everything in the drawers was getting nice and warm without much heat getting directed out into the kitchen. This "vent extender" fits almost perfectly from the wall to toeboard, effectively directing the air out into the kitchen. Fortunately, it's made of cheap plastic that I can cut to put the register cover back on. It is not sitting on even ground under the drawers (hard wood gives way to subfloor), but it still manages to keep the drawers from warming up without leaking much warm air around the edges. It may help that the two pieces of the extender stay overlapped in the space, giving an extra wall of insulation. I was truly surprised by how well this item worked for my purpose. My only criticism is that it's made of cheap, flimsy plastic and is overpriced for the type of material.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Used to extend the register from underneath the bed to room. We needed 2 of them.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Cheaply made

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: As many others have noted, this product does what it says and moves the air from registers behind out to the front. But it is surely is over-priced - this isn't worth any more than $5 to $8. Very flimsy plastic. The provided clip did not hold the extender in place on the register - I had to tape it in place. I also taped the two sections together when fully extended.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Too small for my vents

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Not very impressed. Its plastic.... as soon as the heat hits it, it flattens and warps!!

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: A little flimsy, but works well, had to find a way to really attach it to the vent, and tapeed the 2 pieces together to keep in place, but does what it is supposed to do

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: It does exactly what it is supposed to do.  I use it to redirect the floor vent airflow under my china cabinet.  Some have claimed that the Extend-A-Vent is very fragile.  I have found it to be a fairly durable plastic.  It comes in two pieces.  It seems that for most applications, both pieces could remain stacked together as they are right out of the box (i.e., double thickness - see image).  This greatly adds to the durability, if that is an issue.  If one needs it longer, then purchase another and use the two together.  The material can easily be modified with scissors and/or glue (or tape) to fit custom needs.  By the way, if need be, small magnets (found at most hobby shops) can be added in for those with metal floor vents.  I highly recommend it.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Very thin plastic.  Nothing to hold it to register or hold it in place.  Actually threw it in garbage.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Cheap filmy plastic... like wht they would serve nachos in at a ballpark.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: I wish I'd read other reviews before I bought this.  The plastic is thin and started melting as soon as I placed it over the heater vent; I had to remove it after about 10 seconds when I started smelling burnt plastic, and it's already slightly warped from that brief contact.  This would probably be fine for redirecting cool air, but it's totally unusable for a heater vent.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: way too thin and flimsy

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Plastic is very, very thin. The air easily escapes on the sides bottoms (I don't know why the V shape lips. It's for stabilizing the sliding part, it does nto do the job). The extension part is very loose if you extend until the very end to get the max length. I had to tape the entire vent to the ground to avoid leaks and stabilize it on the floor. When the air is finally out (in my case) it is much colder/warmer due to the loss of temperature along the vent.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Giving this 3 stars because the plastic looks to be good quality but it only comes with one click to attach to your vent. My clip keeps coming loose thru the force of the air thru the vent and Im having to re-attach often which is a big pain as the vent is under my couch. Im sure we can find an additional clip at the local hardware store to provide my enforcement and ensure this stays connecting the vent but it would have been nice if the product came with it.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Cheap....and not as in inexpensive. For what you pay it's not worth it.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: Looking for something beefy and made like right.
Review_Text:
I was willing to modify it to fit my registers as others had stated the size was insufficient, but there's only one clip to attach one side, not the other.  There's no easy/permanent way to attach to the register and honestly so thin and cheap I don't want to bother.  I don't see this lasting more than one season.
I think I could craft something just as strong out of aluminum foil, no joke.  Looking for something beefy and made like right.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: i used to route a/c under a couch.. ...
Review_Text: i used to route a/c under a couch.. the change in humidity against my wood floors cause them to buckle where it was laying. I have removed it and they have started to lay back but still have a big buckle in the floor.. something to consider if you have wood floors.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text:
I'm going up to four stars because I've had this, taped on, to my vent for a few weeks now and it hasn't melted or anything like that.

I'm torn on how many stars to give this. The plastic is so flimsy and Light that you have to tape it down. We shall see if the heat melts it... I was able to tape it down on my linoleum but I ordered two and the other one I wanted in the living room which is carpeted and I'm trying to figure out how I'm going to attach it and make it stay. This is way too high priced for what you get. But seems to be the only option available when searching for such item.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: The thing l like about this product is it is extendable. HOWEVER, it comes with only one clip!!! One clip is not enough to secure it to the floor vent. The other two sides still need clips to secure. Air is still blowing to my furniture. I am trying to make it work, but I don't know how.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: I'm happy that I did that
Review_Text:
Despite of some negative reviews, I took my chance.  I'm happy that I did that.
Though the material may appear thin and flimsy comparing to the much thicker and harder vents sold in Lowe's or HomeDepot, this vent is just right for its job.  In fact, one could argue that this thinner and flimsier product is much harder to break than Lowe's/HomeDepot because of its flexibility.  I broke a few pieces that I bought from Lowe's and HD in the past.
I also really like the fact that its height is about half of the others which fit snugly underneath my TV console.  Its length is very sufficient to ensure the heat/AC will not be pushed / disappear into the furniture above it. I only need one piece and trimmed off 4" from its original length.  There is still another piece that can be easily taped together should the extension is under a much deeper couch.
I didn't bother use the included plastic clip because there is only one and if I ever clip it, I'll clip on all 3 sides.
Instead I use the 2-sided 1"-wide tape cut-to-measure so that all 3 sides of the EXTVENT are held firmly to the existing vent.
I could imagine this kind of installation method would help to divert the heat/AC upward from vents that are installed in the walls.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: great for what I needed it for
Review_Text:
I used this so that we could rearrange a hutch to a different wall and not block the vent.  First- the product is sturdier than I thought-  will it tolerate being stepped on?  I would say no- however it isn't going to fall apart apart on its own.  It is sturdy enough to do what I needed it to do.
The floor vent was larger than this product so I had to use duct tape to shrink down the size of the vent and I used it to secure it to the vent and hold it in place.  It works very well and I am pleasantly surprised at how much airflow we get out of this vent now.
Mine came with two pieces-  one was fitted to go over the vent- the other would slide over the first piece to extend if you need it to.  Mine also included one binder clip.

The major home improvement stores do not carry this type of extender; otherwise, I would have purchased retail.  Unfortunately, buying online is not always good. Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: True that these extenders aren't impressively beefy. True that they want to float up from vent, and that they may not be wide enough to cover entire vent if furniture placement requires they run the long length of the vent. But dry heat was wreaking havoc on a lovely French antique. This doohickey carries the air out from under the piece where in about an inch the air hits an area rug. Two weights placed on top of device anchor it and are hidden by the furniture "skirt". Weights not provided. I improvised. And I bought a sheet of magnetic vent covering material and cut it to fit the 2 inches not covered by this device. All this retrofitting took under five minutes. So. I'm satisfied. Problem fixed.

I went to process a return cuz the top is scuffed up and its SO lightweight and flimsy. If this were a lot heavier it would work. If you have any vent flow above soft its gonna move right off.

The vent it covers is on the third floor when the furnace is on the first. So I could see problems if the air was more forceful. Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: Simple idea and I am super pleased!!
Review_Text: I read the mixed reviews but I have to say, I used some shipping tape and now the front room is so much warmer than it has been the past few years! Im glad it is a flexible plastic because my couch is a little lower and it still works. So practical!!! So glad I purchased!

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: Good product that does the job needed.
Review_Text: We needed some vent extenders in our new house when we found that some of the vents were going to be underneath furniture. We read the reviews. These are light-weight plastic and they are not sturdy. However, they don't need to support any weight and we were placing them under furniture away from foot traffic. And the dimensions were right, and the price was right. This product got the best reviews of the ones available. We've had them in since we moved in last Spring. They do exactly what we need them to do--they channel the heat from from the floor vents out from under the furniture into the room. That prevents damage to the furniture and heats the room more effectively. They are a good product.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Works great!

Review_Text: bought because there was a vent under my dresser.  I used this and it was way too long.  However, I was able to cut it a little shorter and it works perfect.  It stretches far so I could see where it would be great under a couch or other furniture.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Works perfect

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: I use these under my furniture that block the vents. Perfect!

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Horribly cheap and over priced for a piece of thin plastic that won't hold its shape. We ended up cutting apart the cardboard box it came in to rig up a 4th side to this tunnel so it didn't just sink into our carpet. I really expected it to be a long rectangular tube. However, it's the top and sides of a tube, with no bottom side, and made from uber cheap, flimsy plastic. With our cardboard modifications, I'd give it two stars. Amazon has no alternatives (just several listings of this product by different brand names) so we kept it.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: Works. It's quite thin and lightweight though.
Review_Text:
Works. It's quite thin and lightweight though.
I'm using it for an HVAC register infront of a sliding patio door that is covered by drapes & sheers. I currently taped it to the register so it stays in place. Will have to shorten it somehow and find a pretty solution to fix it to the register. It works but it doesn't look particularly nice.

This product would be perfect if it's hidden away under a cabinet / couch / table etc.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: They are great at redirecting the air out from under the shelves
Review_Text: I have 2 of these vent extenders that I use under shelves. They are great at redirecting the air out from under the shelves. They are adjustable so if you have a deeper piece of furniture you can extend it to about double the length. My only complaint is that I wish this was a little bit wider. This extender covers most of my vents but not all of it, so some of the air still gets "stuck" under the shelves. My 19 lb toddler steps on one of them a lot and it has not broken or cracked, which surprises me since they are not very thick. Overall, this is a great product and it has allowed me to arrange furniture the way I want it and not be hindered by a vent.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Only thing they did was make the carpet cold underneath it, did not help the room temperature.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: Huge temperature difference in our bedroom
Review_Text: This may be nothing more than a piece of plastic but omg what a difference it makes. Seriously I noticed a drastic different in our bedroom temperature at night after placing this under my nightstand directing the air out in front of it instead of under it. It was worth the $15 dollars and I'll be buying another one for my living room for under the couch. I looked at my local lowe's home improvement store to see if I could find anything like this for cheaper, and they didn't have anything similar in their air vent section.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: For me, it does what it's suppose to do: redirecting the air flow of a covered vent
Review_Text: I needed to reroute the airflow from an HVAC vent on the wall to flow away from a large cabinet I had placed in front of the vent. The Extend-A-Vent did exactly what I needed it to do, redirect the airflow for cooling and heating that area of the house. It changed what would have been a useless, covered/blocked vent into a useful one providing cooled or heated air to the area.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Flimsy for the price, but works well.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Unless your couch sits a couple inches off the floor it won't work.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Works Perfect :-) Our couch is really low, it fit perfectly and does what it is suppose to do. It comes with one clip to attach it to the vent cover, We are happy with it.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Very flimsy.. didn't really do the job.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: Super thin and cheap plastic, but it actually works great!
Review_Text: I bought 2 of these and use them in 2 rooms where furniture is covering up floor vents. These direct the cool air out from under the couch and into the room. Perfect!

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Does the job, but certainly not worth the price. Upon opening, I was throughly disappointed. Just two pieces of thin, flexible plastic. Not even thick like my other deflectors. Will do the job for now.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Works as advertised.  So glad to move my couch against the back wall in my living room. I used gorilla tape to tape the product down to the floor since it will just slide around otherwise. Like the other reviews said... it's a very simple product and likely not worth more than $10 but the plastic is of higher quality than many of the diy projects I've noticed.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: I purchased this product, not exactly for what it was intended, but it still works very well.  My drapes are the length of the register and the air was blowing behind and underneath the drapes.  The register there, didn't help the situation, as it needed to be longer.  So, I purchased this product.  It goes sideways, still, but enough of the air disperses and does not go under the drapes and blow them.  So, for that reason, it did work well.  I gave it a 4* because it is not a very sturdy plastic.  I wish the manufacturer would make one to turn the other way instead of sideways.  I'll buy another one for 2 other rooms that have the same problem.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text:
I love it! It definitely has helped keep my room cool during these hot summer days. My vent is right below my window, and my windows could use some updating since air escapes so well. I wish it could extend longer, but its purpose wasn't made for the length I need. Even though 1-2 feet short of legth needed, it has still helped A LOT.
I also have a 2 year old toddler that just loves jumping on it, and it hasn't broke yet! Pretty flexible!

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: best to duct tape the joints together but gets the job done

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: It's working GREAT under my couch
Review_Text: Just received this item. It's working GREAT under my couch, redirecting our AC. Just ordered another one for my daughter's room. Very pleased.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Too narrow, flimsy, too shallow

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: SWEET

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: Decent product, needs some user love to get to 5 stars in-use.
Review_Text: They do their job reasonably well. What I don't think the pictures convey is that they are very thin packaging, approximately the same thickness that electronics or batteries come in. So all my vents blow them harder than they are intended to and the single little plastic clip they come with is mostly useless to help them stay in place. I have taken (since they are used to push air out from under something) to using a spacer between the bottom of the furniture above them and their top to keep them in place.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: The plastic is terribly thin and flimsy
Review_Text: The plastic is terribly thin and flimsy. It feels like the plastic on the paint tray liners. It also only comes with one clip, so I had to find something to clip the other side with. Totally not worth the price.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Very good product.  Works as advertised.  A little pricey but would buy again.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: I don't know who the architect was that designed my house but every vent seem to be in the wrong place. Bought these and my house is cooler and warmer than it ever was. Set the length and taped them together. Need some double sided tape to keep the cat and the vacuum from moving them. Great buy.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: This worked great for the vents that had the backs of couches against them. I was hoping that with the extension piece that it could bend at a 90 degree angle or something. Even with this extended, it just blows the air further under my bed and there's no way around it with the shape of my room. I'd like to see a 2nd generation of this that allows for the extender to be angled a bit!

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: Flimsy plastic does the job but not worth the money
Review_Text: I read the reviews and I thought I still wanted this product, but when it arrived, I understood just what people are complaining about.  I agree with the reviewer who compares the plastic to that of a paint roller liner and I understand now why someone said theirs melted from the hot air from their furnace.  I bought this product to go underneath a futon in my 5-year-old son's room.  I know as soon as he finds it, he's going to play with it and try to drive his trucks over it.  This product is extremely flimsy and would probably work fine in a adult room or underneath a sofa or something where it cannot be seen or touched, although I wonder now about it melting from hot air in the winter.  I would have paid around $5 for it but $14 is too much to pay for this type of quality.  I am going to look into returning it.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Works great now i can put furniture over the silly air vents

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: I recommend you don't buy these unless you're absolutely certain you'll ...
Review_Text: This is a cheap, flimsy product that absolutely is not worth the $14 we paid. They are the quality and consistency of a thin plastic carton you might get at the grocery store salad bar. They didn't fit our vents, and now the seller is charging $7.30 to return them. Absolute ripoff. I recommend you don't buy these unless you're absolutely certain you'll want to keep them. And honestly, you could do better by using a bent piece of cardboard.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Cheap but serves it's purpose.

Review_Text: I was skeptical after reading some of the negative reviews regarding this product, but I went ahead and ordered one to see for myself.  I really don't have an issue with the quality or the price that others had written about.  I find it to be sturdy enough to go under my couch to redirect the heat from the register.  It states that it is unbreakable ~ I believe it.  I like that way it extends to fit most needs and I am considering purchasing another at some point for another area in my home.  It's nice to have heat coming from an area in my living room that I normally have closed off so as not to harm fabric or finishes on surfaces.

Review_Text: Does its job. I read the other comments and was prepared for its flimsiness. Still, it did what I needed it to do (in our case, redirect the air upwards from an oddly-placed wall vent a foot off the floor behind where we moved our couch). The couch itself helps keep it it in place, along with a few strips of double-side tape.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: I Don't Recommend It Unless You're Handy With A Glue Gun and Magnets
Review_Text: It does what it is intended to do when you can keep it in place, otherwise I wouldn't squeak out a second star.  The two layers of plastic "vent" material don't actually connect together.  One just slides over the other.  The piece that goes over the floor vent doesn't attach to the floor vent.  It just sits on top of it.  Out cat likes to crawl under the couch, constantly knocking it off the floor vent.  With a glue gun and some magnets, I'm hoping to correct the very poor design qualities of the Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A-Vent.  If I'd have known about this beforehand, I've not have purchased it.  I've had just spent the time and $10 for materials at the hobby shop and made my own.

Review_Title: It seems to be working fine, but I don't trust that I am going ...

Review_Text: I love being able to redirect the out flow from our air vents.  We just have to be careful not to put much weight on them since the plastic is not strong, but since they are under furniture, this isn't a real problem.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: Helps bring air into room if vent is obstructed.
Review_Text:
These are nice to direct air flow if you have a couch or other large object that obstructs the vent cover.  My dog tends to hog it during the summer after playing outside.  Funny to watch her plant herself in front of it as she knows it's direct A/C.  That's proof that it works.

I secured mine with painters tapes all along the side and back to make sure air only comes out of the front. Very effective after that.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Shockingly these actually work! I have two heat vents in a very large master bedroom and unfortunately the way it's laid out I can only have my bed over the two heat vents. If we have the furnace at 67 at night it will be 63 in my room in the winter. I had to jerryrig these a little bit to get them to work but now my room stays at 66.5. Vast improvement- can't wait to see how it helps with the air conditioning!

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF

Review_Text: This worked better than I thought it would. Warm air pours out of the front of this instead of into the bottom of my dresser. Like the other reviews said, this extremely cheap piece of plastic. I hope it holds up.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF

It is not as sturdy as the Air Vent Deflectors and I would not purchase this Extend a Vent ever again. Wasted money!! Build your own little cheap concoction and save your money.

Review_Text: Product works as advertised. Yes, it does feel a bit flimsy, but it directs the air out from under my couch with a good amount of force. There is even a small clip that keeps it loosely attached to the vent.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: Don't be surprised but it works...
Review_Text: Not a solid plastic as it may seem. I would compare the flimsiness to a high end paper plate. You know like the ones that can withstand you holding it with one hand with heavy food on it without it bending and spilling on you. It does what it should but don't be surprised by the plastic's thickness.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Works like a charm!!

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: It directs the air like it should, however, I wish it were wider (it's a couple of inches too short for the width of my vents) and there should be a way to lock in the length once you slide it out.  Our vent is under a sofa and, if we happen to hit it with our feet, it retracts a bit.  I put duct tape on it (good ole duct tape!) but shouldn't have to.  It's overpriced for what it is (flimsy piece of plastic) but there weren't any other options out there that I could find.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Blows right off the vent. Too flimsy to be held in place by a heavy object. Useless.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: This product does exactly as claimed and it works fine for me. If they made ones available that were magnetic on the bottom so as to stick to the vent that would be really GREAT. The plastic is fine material for this product to avoid breakage if it is stepped upon.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: A solution to a problem. Walks a fine line between cost effective and flimsy craftsmanship.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Looked good in the description. I should have read the details and reviews. Firstly, it is too small in width for many US registers. This product only spanned about 80% of our register. (About 13 inches). Secondly our new furnace literally lifted the light weight plastic off the floor. Only If you have narrow registers And your airflow is slow this might be a good choice.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Like all the other reviewers have already said - it is not wide enough to cover the entire vent. We used Gorilla Tape to tape it to the metal vent, blocking the airflow and forcing all the air to the Extend-A-Vent. We also didn't need the full extension and cut probably 6 inches off the vent with an exacto knife. The whole process to install took 10-15 minutes with all our modifications. This sits underneath a nightstand, allowing the nightstand to be beside the bed, where it should be and allow air into the room. I agree it is expensive for what it is, but it should last forever the way we have it situated and it does exactly what it is supposed to, so it is worth the cost to me.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: I love this invention! I have a fairly large couch that covers the air vent and it would dramatically affect the climate in my living room. Once I put the extender on I was in love. I bet it will save me on my heating and cooling bill as well. The only down fall is that my robot vacuum cleaner bumps it off the register as its so light weight. I'm going to hold it in place with some bricks. NO biggie!

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: The product is pretty flimsy, however, it works great.  I can "cover" my vents with furniture and use one of these Extend-A-Vents and the cool air comes right out.  I just wished the plastic vent was more sturdy.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: it works fine, but cheaply made

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Simple solution to help draw the air from a vent under a couch, bed or any elevated furniture blocking a vent.  The clip didn't stay secured to the vent causing it to constantly move.  My quick fix was taping the cover to the vent with some extra tape to seal against the floor.  It's not the best solution but since the vent and the vent cover are under a bed, it works well.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: Deflects air but could be made much better
Review_Text: I purchased the Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF to go under my couch.  This is made of extremely thin plastic.  It comes with one clip to attach it to the vent which i was not able to use.  The two pieces of this extender do not connect together with anything so I had to tape them together to keep from separating.  I think this extend-a-vent is extremely overpriced for the quality of the item.  It does serve its purpose and deflect the air.  You just need to add some tape and creativity to get it to work for you.

Review_Text: This product really does work good with the airflow. My rooms are small so furniture is covering some of the vents but this seems to help. I will need a couple more.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: I bought a house that has vents right where I have furniture. I have been keeping them closed so as to not ruin my furniture form the heat or cold. I knew I had to open these vent so I searched for a product that could help me move the air that wouldn't cost me a fortune. I was a little leery after reading the reviews, but I got it anyway. I'm very happy I did. Reviews said that it was really thin. I was surprise that it wasn't what I was expecting. I was expecting it to be like a paint pan liner, but it was a little heavier. It doesn't come with anything to hold it down. Not sure why. So I went and bought a roll of magnetic tape and attached it. It works perfectly and I can't believe the amount of air coming out form under my furniture. Cheaply made, yes, but it does what it says it will do.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF

I put a piece of broken plant ceramic I save for drainage in other plant pots, and I guess I'll eventually use some carpet tape to make it stay, but it will divert the air if you work at it. ha.  I just didn't see anything else that would work under a couch.  Furniture sits low, and those other vent divertors (sp) are too high.  Good luck!

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: Grossly overpriced at best, inefficient at worst...
Review_Text:
Most standard adjustable air deflectors are fairly inexpensive ($<5 ea), constructed of a rigid plastic, and use magnets to attach to the register. Given the $13 cost of this "extended" version, I expected the product to be of similar or better quality.

Alas, I regret not reading the negative reviews. As others have noted, this deflector reminds me of the cheap disposable liners used for paint trays. It is made of a very thin plastic, and only a small plastic clip is provided to hold it to the register.

I needed this device to extend out almost the entire length. Unfortunately, because of its flimsy design, it simply wouldn't stay in place.  The cost of returning it forced me to be a little creative. I put a magnetic adjustable deflector over top of the EXTVENT to hold it in place, and then I used the provided clip to hold the extensions together.

Review_Title: It DOES slide around and off the vent easily though (especially in a room where kids play) and ...
Review_Text: Works well to redirect the heat. We had to put the crib over the vent when we learned #3 is coming (we only have 2 bedrooms so the kids all share). There is only a little bit of heat floating up to the crib, but that is because our vent is wider than the extender. It is just enough to keep the baby warm though so we aren't worried about it. It DOES slide around and off the vent easily though (especially in a room where kids play) and so we used adhesive strips to attach it to the floor (hardwood laminate). I don't know how you would keep it in place on carpet unless it was tightly wedged under something. Overall we are happy with it- it solved our problem and with a little tweaking, it is a great solution!

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: After reading the reviews, I was skeptical about this product but took the plunge and ordered it because we recently bought a condo that has window placements that make it impossible to arrange furniture without covering a heating vent. After a spell of cold weather, it became clear that either the sofa would have to be moved (this meant relocating all the cable hookups also) or something was going to have to be done to deflect the warm air out from under it. It fits right over our vent and doesn't show at all under the sofa. Best of all it works! Granted, it is fairly flimsy plastic but since it is also supposed to be used under furniture, that is not an issue with me. It is also probably overpriced but it certainly didn't break the bank and the thing solved our problem. The air is now directed out into the room instead of up under the sofa.

Review_Text: Works nice since it is under a dresser, but it won't stay attached to the vent, so if you put it somewhere where a pet or child can get under it, be prepared to move it back in place all the time.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: Does the job - with a little assistance
Review_Text: It is just a bit thicker than a paint tray liner and when extended, you will probably have to tack or tape down the outer edges to keep the air flowing out of the end.  I think for the price, they should have produced a thicker, studier plastic.  But it was all I could find and it does the job.  It does include a small clip to keep it on the vent cover, but comes off easily, so you may want to reinforce that as well.  I use it under a sofa.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: works well, it is overpriced but there aren't any ...
Review_Text: works well, it is overpriced but there aren't any other options out there at this time that we have found.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: It does the trick for redirecting the air from an air vent under my sofa.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: It was easy to cut down to the size we needed
Review_Text: It does the job, and effectively re-directs air from underneath our furniture. It was easy to cut down to the size we needed. Others reviews are accurate: it's low profile, it's thin plastic, and rather pricey for what it offers. I'd give it a higher rating if it wasn't so expensive.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Title: They work as I expected. you need magnetic tape ...
Review_Text: They work as I expected.  you need magnetic tape to hold it on a metal vent and tape to hold it together.  It will but hot and cold air into to the room and not into the drapes.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text:
THIS VENT EXTENDER IS GARBAGE AND SHOULD BE SOLD AT A "DOLLAR STORE" BECAUSE THAT IS ALL IT'S WORTH IS $1.00.  I bought mine from Miles Kimball for 1/2 this price and will be returning them. This vent extender is the same plastic as those Red disposal plastic Party cups, so these vents are throw-away.

  DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME AND YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY..

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: This item is cheaply made, but in the situation I planned to use it, it worked.  The clip for attaching the vent extender to the floor vent is not strong enough to hold it in place, so I used a paperback book to add some weight.

Product_Name: Dundas Jafine EXTVENT Extend-A- Vent Air DEF
Review_Text: Immediately melted and warped after less than 2 minutes in front of the vent. Same issue even when it was held two inches away from the vent. This is worthless--pass on it. Get some metal or plexiglass and DIY it.

Review_Title: Im embarrassed to say I paid for and had a piece of plastic sent to my house.. don't tell my mom.
Review_Text: This thing is literally a piece of random plastic. Like... I cant believe I actually paid for this this. It never worked in the first place but then its a giant plastic tray.. so both me and my dog tripped/kicked the thing like 20 times. Cause I mean... who has a random piece of plastic in the middle of the floor? To be fair, my dog ended up playing with the thing, so it wasn't a total waste. Do yourself a favor and put some HGTV on and DIY the crap out of this idea. Im sure you can figure out something by using stuff like random table scraps or some duct tape.

Review_Title: These filters do not last long!!!
Review_Text: I bought a single pack of these exact filters last year, and it performed perfectly for several months. I decided it was time to change it because the water was flowing out in a trickle. I then bought this 2 pack in March, and both filters are clearly defective. Upon initial installation, both produced water at the normal, high flow rate. Then, the first filter I installed died in just 2 months. Thinking it was defective, I installed the second one, and it didn't even last one month. The failure mechanism is: the water flow rate goes from the normal, high flow rate that will fill a 16oz water bottle up in 5-10 seconds, to a trickle where it takes 1-2 minutes to fill up the same bottle. See the attached video; this is what it looked like when all three of these filters failed. Thinking it could my refrigerator freezing the filter, I removed the one in the refrigerator and let it sit on my counter over night; after reinstalling it, the flow rate was still a trickle. My refrigerator isn't the problem; the OEM filters never had this issue. There's something wrong with this brand of filters.

Product_Name: EcoAqua Replacement Filter, Compatible with Maytag UKF8001, EDR4RXD1, Whirlpool 4396395, Puriclean II, Kenmore 46-9006, Everydrop Filter 4, Viking RWFFR Refrigerator Water Filter, 2 Pack

Review_Title: Water still tasted like it was coming out of a garden hose weeks after install - Returned product
Review_Text:
First and last time buying knock off water filter replacements.  I've replaced the water filters before and am aware of how much water should be run through the filter after installation.  After running one of these filters for 2+ weeks and gallons and gallons and gallons of use, the water still smelled like plastic and tasted like it was coming out of a garden hose. I even to empty all the ice in my ice machine since the odor and taste spoiled anything that came in contact with the ice.
I would not use the water coming through this filter for my 3 month old's formula, nor as drinking water for my 3 year old.  The wife refused to drink it as well.
Thankfully this was a Prime product and I was able to return it free of charge.

Buyer beware.

Product_Name: EcoAqua Replacement Filter, Compatible with Maytag UKF8001, EDR4RXD1, Whirlpool 4396395, Puriclean II, Kenmore 46-9006, Everydrop Filter 4, Viking RWFFR Refrigerator Water Filter, 2 Pack
Review_Title: I decided to keep using to see if it got better. It slowly has gotten better now that I ...
Review_Text: Similar to other reviews, this filter did leave a "plastic" taste longer than it should have. I ran approximately 3 gallons through it when first installed. I decided to keep using to see if it got better. It slowly has gotten better now that I am about 20-25 gallons into the filter. I want to believe my filter was a one off issue because it happens. I hope the second filter does not give me that same taste 20 gallons in.

Review_Text: This is the first reply water filter I have bought that has an extra little rubber gasket. Mine was not attached, and I couldn't determine if I needed it. Review_Title: Works, but never purges air bubbles out.
Review_Text: These filters fit our Kitchenaid, but they never seemed to purge air bubbles out. I flushed the new filter as recommended, but several months after use, the water dispenser still spatters water. The original filter never did this. It is also louder when dispensing water, probably because of the air bubbles in the line. The filter serves its purpose, but spattering water is annoying. I'll be trying a different brand in the future instead.

the water that came out of my refrigerator when cold was good. But when it sat a bit and warmed up to room temperature it tasted just like chlorine. I guess I will have to spend the money and get the PUR one that I used to get. I was really hoping this would work, I can get two of these for less than the price of one of those, oh well.

Review_Text: This filter is slightly shorter than the OEM Pur Filter 4.  The filter door in my Maytag fridge depends on the filter being the proper length to secure it when pushed up into position.  If the filter is too short the filter does not wedge itself into position and consequently rests on the filter door.  The fastening clip on the filter door does not lock firmly enough to secure the EcoAqua filter resting on it.  Consequently I had to fashion a wedge to fit on the end of the EcoAqua filter to secure it when pushed up into position.  I just installed the filter so I have no opinion how well it filters.

Product_Name: EcoAqua Replacement Filter, Compatible with Maytag UKF8001, EDR4RXD1, Whirlpool 4396395, Puriclean II, Kenmore 46-9006, Everydrop Filter 4, Viking RWFFR Refrigerator Water Filter, 2 Pack
Review_Title: BEWARE : may be a gamble with this filter purchase!
Review_Text: First time purchasing this brand refrigerator filter. Will not buy again. After following all instructions, the water had a bad taste to it. We were sure to filter out 2 1/2 gallons upon initial install. So went to other customer reviews and there were other similar issues with their purchase. We followed what another reviewer was told when they contacted customer service. Remove filter and hold filter under warm water. Wound up disposing of the first of the twin pack. Interesting how the second one was fine. So it's a gamble whether you will be lucky enough to have gotten your money's worth buying this brand. Had no issues with other off brands. Will go back to the previous manufacturer.

Product_Name: EcoAqua Replacement Filter, Compatible with Maytag UKF8001, EDR4RXD1, Whirlpool 4396395, Puriclean II, Kenmore 46-9006, Everydrop Filter 4, Viking RWFFR Refrigerator Water Filter, 2 Pack
Review_Text: This is my second purchase of this filter. It is an excellent alternative to the brand name filter as it is much less expensive and seems to filter the water equally as well. Probably the exact same filter with a different sticker on it.

Review_Text: I'm not sure this product actually works. I have terrible water and this is a second carbon filter in my system. This product however has failed to do so, the smell seems to be mostly gone but the taste is horrendous which leads me to believe the quality of these are very low. The original filters even worked past when they were recommended to be changed. This is far from needing changed and doesn't help my water. In the future I will definitely spend the few extra dollars for the better filters.

Review_Text: This was our first time purchasing non OEM filters to save a few dollars.  Even after several weeks our ice and water still have a slight off flavor we never noticed before using OEM filters.  We go through one filter a year so we know it's not just a seasonal change in our tap water.

Product_Name: EcoAqua Replacement Filter, Compatible with Maytag UKF8001, EDR4RXD1, Whirlpool 4396395, Puriclean II, Kenmore 46-9006, Everydrop Filter 4, Viking RWFFR Refrigerator Water Filter, 2 Pack
Review_Title: the water tasted pretty bad. It actually tasted much worse than the ...
Review_Text:
After replacing the factory filter and flushing out at least 15-20 gallons, the water tasted pretty bad. It actually tasted much worse than the 8 month old filter the fridge came with.
My wife and kids wouldn't drink the water and use the ice so we ended up using bottled water.
I ended up buying a Maytag branded filter and after flushing out 5 gallons the nasty taste was gone.
I thought it was a bargain but I wouldn't buy this filter again.

Product_Name: EcoAqua Replacement Filter, Compatible with Maytag UKF8001, EDR4RXD1, Whirlpool 4396395, Puriclean II, Kenmore 46-9006, Everydrop Filter 4, Viking RWFFR Refrigerator Water Filter, 2 Pack

Review_Title: Perfect fit in my Maytag fridge, at half the cost of name brand filters!
Review_Text:
I balked at paying $35 for a Maytag replacement filter, so I took a chance and ordered this two-pack.  I'm pleased to report that it fits my refrigerator just like the Maytag filter, and makes the drinking water and ice cubes taste great.  I use a sharpie marker to put the month and year of installation on the side of the filter, to help me remember when to change it.  My fridge prompts me every six months to replace the filter, but because we have a whole-house filter water passes through before getting to the fridge I usually go 8-9 months between changes.

At half the cost of a Maytag filter, I'll buy these again!

Product_Name: EcoAqua Replacement Filter, Compatible with Maytag UKF8001, EDR4RXD1, Whirlpool 4396395, Puriclean II, Kenmore 46-9006, Everydrop Filter 4, Viking RWFFR Refrigerator Water Filter, 2 Pack

Review_Text:
Shipped quickly, but I don't think it was packaged very well by the seller (Deepdiscountco).  They came in a plastic envelope, but there was no padding, so the boxes were beat up pretty well.  The filters seemed to work well, but they were missing the larger "outer" gasket, but I used the gasket from the old filter.  They did come with the smaller "inner" gasket.  I suspect you want both, to avoid leaking.  I thought the foil seal over the filter opening was a nice touch.

As it stands one week out, I would buy this filter again, but I might choose another seller.  Water tastes better and there was not much carbon fine leakage into the water, and that flushed out quickly.  I will update this review when I need to replace the filter, to reflect how long the filter lasts.

Product_Name: EcoAqua Replacement Filter, Compatible with Maytag UKF8001, EDR4RXD1, Whirlpool 4396395, Puriclean II, Kenmore 46-9006, Everydrop Filter 4, Viking RWFFR Refrigerator Water Filter, 2 Pack

Wouldn't surprise me if the lead they took out of baby toys over the past 2-3 years is in these filters. Save your money and your taste buds. BTW: I've owned my refrigerator for 5 years and NEVER had an issue with Pure Clean II, so don't tell me to "flush the system" (which I have subsequently done).

Review_Text: Beware of those 5 stars reviews.  The reviewers just purchased it recently.  Sure, the freezer looks great, and worked well initially.  But, they don't last long. In about 10 months, the freezing unit on the top shelf stopped working.  Fool me twice, it's my fault!  The freezer is made in China.  Any electrical device made in China invariably have quality issues.  I have numerous experiences to back up my observations.

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White
Review_Title: Just Plug it In, You're Ready to Go with this Reliable Game Changing Freezer
Review_Text:
This mighty and surprisingly roomy freezer has been a game changer for us.  We've had pretty limited freezer space due to constraints in our kitchen.  If we could have a bigger refrigerator/freezer combo we would.  Alas, we can't.  We had thought about buying an additional freezer for our basement, and always thought in terms of a larger one, and really didn't want to go that route.  So I was pleasantly surprised to see several options on Amazon.  After reading all the reviews, I settled on this one, and we couldn't be happier.

We've had this freezer for more than six months now, ahead of the demanding holidays when we always need additional freezer space. What a game changer!  We were surprised by how much this freezer holds, how easy it was to install - just plug it into a "regular" socket in our somewhat "older" basement, and it was ready to go.  Now we don't know how we ever lived without it and wonder what took us so long.

This unit is also quiet, which - even though it's tucked away - is not a bad thing when we do go downstairs for laundry and other errands.  We're hoping it continues to be as reliable and effective as it is right now, and are so pleased by the great price and the huge difference it's made for us.

I would recommend this to anyone.

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White
Review_Title: Unreliable freezer; manufacturer needs to add a fail light ON alarm.
Review_Text:
I really enjoyed the idea of a chest freezer in our apartment. After much research and reviews, I found that this is the best freezer I could get. When I got this fridge delivered to me, it was exactly what we were looking for and it fit the kitchen perfectly. We put all our long term storage items in there; including meats, and quick meals.
The freezer worked perfectly for 2 months. The green light on the bottom is on my vicinity and notice when I leave home and come back. Its on button is always a relief. One night, I woke up in the middle of my sleep, went to the kitchen for a glass of water, and what do I see? a green light from the freezer, but blood ALL OVER MY KITCHEN. The next hour went by so fast trying to clean up and trying to figure out what went wrong.
There was no indication that the freezer went bad. I opened the freezer and everything was in room temperature. This means that it was out for couple of days and all my foods are bad now.
Being nice, I requested feed back from Danby (through Amazon support), no response. I had to return this product (I really hate returning) because I had no choice. All of my food went bad including some premium meat I was excitedly waiting for the right time for :P.
Summary to the manufacturer: Please add a fail light on alarm. That way at least I am aware to save my foods. I really don't know how this passed quality assurance.
Summary to consumers: Unreliable freezer; Manufacturer has the right idea, but they need to get a version 2 with 1 more feature.

(Photo taken towards the end of clean up; forgot to document. You can see the green light; and blood stains still on the tiles from my meat.)

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White
Review_Text:
Avoid this product. After installation I was amazed at how quickly it needed defrosting. The gasket looked fine until I examined the gasketing along the hinge side of the door. There is a continuous 1/4" gap between the gasket and the body of the freezer (see photo) allowing warm room air into the freezer!
I thought okay I'll just adjust the hinge pin positioning on the door/freezer. They are fixed in this position- not adjustable. My only option is to add D-profile gasketing to reduce but not eliminate the gap completely. Note also the photo shows a small dent in the door. While this did not cause the gasket issue, it does indicate the shoddy packaging given to this product. In sum I'd say this product is inferior due to poor design, poor quality control and poor product shipping protection.
Do Not Buy.

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White
Review_Text: my freezer is from 2014 and still going strong. quiet, keeps a steady temperature (i keep a thermometer in there to monitor, i also do this in my fridge too, to keep track if its starting to fail, you don't want to find out after your food has gone bad), so i know that it keeps a great temp. i have it at about 75% and that stays at about -5 to -10. 50% keeps it -5 to 0. i never turned it up to 100% but i imagine that would probably put you at -10 to -15. the freezer is very quiet, works great, and doesnt freezer burn my food. the seal is very good, i don't see any air leaks. im very happy and definitely would purchase again. i was happy with this one because instead of it being taller in height and wider in depth, it was shorter in height narrower in depth (longer in length to make up the space) which meant i could actually put it in the back of my car's hatchback to get it home!!!! the other one was too wide on the depth measurement and wouldnt fit. its still the same cubic feet, its just a little longer instead of wider. i know this has nothing to do with the freezer, but if you don't have a truck, you can still get a freezer if you get this one!!! none of the other models would fit!!

Im not sure why they decided to attempt to deliver it to the back door as we have a small staircase that goes up to the door. After contacting the customer service for the delivery service they had it re-delivered a few days later.

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White
Review_Text: AWESOME!  I Read Every review... Good and Bad.  Decided to buy.  This freezer is of a quality that I have not seen in my 65 years.  Excellent quality.  Delivered by UPS, (amazing for its large size and weight), the freezer arrived in perfect shape.  Excellent packaging.  EASY to set up.  I immediately placed 3 thermometers inside and plugged it in.  2 hours later, the temp was -12 degrees.  Set thermostat to warmest  setting and my thermometers registered lower than 10 degrees after 6 hours.  So, this thermostat is not good for refrigeration temperatures,  Not  to worry, there are many easy ways around this if you might someday need a refrigerator instead of a freezer.

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White
Review_Title: and I like it. There are a few things that bother ...
Review_Text: I've had this freezer for a month now, and I like it.  There are a few things that bother me. 1.  It gurgles for a minute when the compressor kicks in.  2. The green light only signifies that the unit is getting power.  It doesn't mean that it is actually keeping your food frozen. 3. Even though using the freezer is simple, the manual that comes with it is almost useless and misleading.  The manual says that when you receive your product, it is ready to use.  That is not necessarily true.  If it hasn't been shipped upright, you will need to let it stand upright for, I would recommend, 24 hours until you plug it in.  Also, the drain plug doesn't unscrew.  It pulls out, but the manual doesn't tell you that.  I was worried that I might break it.

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White
Review_Title: Great Freezer, but came very dinged up.
Review_Text:
Great Freezer, but came very dinged up.
Great size and appears good quality.  Arrived very banged up.
I cannot understand the damage as the outer box had rips and damage, so took pictures. Then opened and found it was doubled boxed. I was thrilled as I figured the freezer was protected from any of the outside box damage...but when then next box was opened the freezer was significantly dented on all but one corner edge. The greatest concern was a very bad dent where the compressor is. Amazon the great company they are, was going  to send an immediate replacement, but I was heading out of town and could not wait for a new freezer to arrive.
I called Danby just to be sure the freezer was sounding as it should and decided to keep it and wait to return if need be.
So far so good. Impressed with size. It holds a lot. Also impressed with how quiet it runs.
Only disappointment was the damage in delivery or possibly damage from the factory.

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White
Review_Title: Had Shipping/Packaging Issues, But Freezer Works Well
Review_Text:
So I had a bit of a struggle with this freezer. The first one that arrived has several small dents on it, and then there was a hole inside of it on one of the bottom corners. I had to repackage and return it for another one. The second freezer had one big dent on one of the outside corner edges, but it had no other issues and I didn't want to return another, so I let Amazon know and they gave me a decent partial refund. The freezer just needs to be packed better when shipped out. Both came in only cardboard, plastic wrap and foam pieces for only 2 sides of the freezer. It needs to be encased in foam and/or bubble wrap (or something).

As for the freezer's actual performance, the freezer has been plugged in for a few weeks now, and it works quite well. It's big enough for me to do the occasional binge shopping of freezer foods (veggies, fruits, sorbets) and have it all fit, unlike my other freezer spaces that I have. Things stay cold and freeze quickly, just the way they should.

Review_Title: BAD PRODUCT - LOUSY FREEZER - Just feeling stuck.
Review_Text: The return window closed April 27, this Freezer is broken and all the food is ruined. It just slowly quit cooling/freezing. It worked for just under 90 days.  Melted ice cream was all over the bottom of the freezer.  The Manufacturer guarantees this product for only 30 days. I cannot find any phone numbers to contact Amazon to return or get refund on this. Like someone else said, Money just wasted. $200.00 !?? The only way to find a phone number for Amazon is to buy a book??? This is so frustrating and disappointing. I will certainly not buy anything this expensive on Amazon again. RATS!!! Of course, this is made in China.

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White
Review_Text:
I just received the new freezer a few hours ago.  By reading others reviews, I was concerned that there would be a big dent or scratch once I got through the packaging... but I was pleasantly surprised.  The chest freezer was a box within a box and a layer of Styrofoam in the middle.  Not a dent, not a scratch.  I plugged it in at the nearest outlet to ensure the system was operating and within 5 minutes, parts of the inside walls were already getting pretty cold.  It's been several hours and it very cold now.  The unit is relatively light and has two wheel casters in back for ease of movement.

The reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 stars?  Upon further inspection, I noticed the drain plug was missing.  I thought it easier and faster just to order one from the Danby's affiliate parts partner... which is true... BUT the $1.89 part is going to cost $7.99 to ship to my home.  There's the rub.

Review_Title: Do not purchase if you need a freezer in your garage
Review_Text: Don't waste your money on this.  If you are going to put this in your garage, that automatically voids your warranty.  They told me it has to be in a temperature controlled environment and an attached garage does not qualify.  It worked great for the first few months, then stopped about 2 months before the one-year warranty expired (and ruined all the food I had kept in there), but when I called to get it repaired under the warranty, they said they couldn't repair it because it's in a garage.  I know of only one person in my life that has their freezer in a place other than their garage.  The Frigidaire that I had running next to this Danby unit has been working for 5 years great in the garage.  I told them thanks for the clarification that this product does not fit my needs and belongs in the trash.  DO NOT BUY THIS IF YOU'RE GOING TO PUT IT IN THE GARAGE.
