Review_Text: I just ordered the Danby 8.5 cubic foot freezer and am very pleased with it.  It is just perfect for my needs!  First of all, it arrived from Amazon right on schedule.  It did not have any dents or scratches on it! I/we did have to reverse the way the door opened on it.  It really helps to have another person to do this with; it wasn't terribly difficult.  It arrived pre-set on the number 4, which seems fine but I am not sure yet as my freezer thermometer has not arrived yet.( I will update later.)  It did seem a little larger then the dimensions mentioned in the advertising however, this wasn't any real problem for me as I was easily able to accommodate it.  I could possibly use a light inside it but it really isn't a necessity.  The only difficulty I have had with this so far, is leaving the door ajar.  Although it closes tightly, you must make certain the door is closed.  It's easy to close the door within an inch or two of the jamb, but it doesn't really "snap" shut like other appliances do.  I really do like this freezer.  It is so much easier to use then my new Samsung bottom freezer in which things are always a piled in jumbled mess.

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White
Review_Text: Nice little freezer.  Perfect size for my food truck.  Holds temp well.  Gets into negative territory  (-5 F or better) unlike many of these little freezers.  Only complaint is that it arrived with 3 of the four attachments for the plastic top broken.  Didn't affect the operation of the freezer so I didn't send it back.  Thinking about buying another one.  Recommended.

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White
Review_Title: Arrived damaged.  Sending back for replacement.  2nd being returned also.  Third arrived fine.
Review_Text:
7.2 Cu ft freezer arrived damaged, although the shipping boxes (box within box) did not appear damaged at all.  The bottom metal motor mounting plate was bent up from bottom, the motor and tubing had dented the "floor" above it.  Also, the lid was dented where 2 "protective" spacers were placed.  The lid had 2 cracks inside where it had pushed down onto the hanging basket.  Shipping boxes appear fine.  Wonder where the damage occurred.  Before it's even packaged at Danby factory?  Strange.  Set up a replacement through amazon. I'll package it up and they will pick it up for free and replacement is already scheduled to arrive in a week.  I will update the review then.  Looking forward to having a non-damaged working freezer!  It looks nice an spacious.

UPDATE: 2nd freezer arrived today. (Fast shipping!)  It has numerous minor scratches and dents. I can deal with that. However the lid does not seal tight along the back. The sides and front are fine, but in the back there is about an eighth inch gap letting out cold air. This is not acceptable as we would be wasting energy constantly and there would be greater frost build up inside. Will be returning for a 3rd replacement. Maybe "Third times a charm"? Or we could get worse, but I don't think the gap in seal is functional, so I need to return it. Tried sitting on the top and it didn't push it down either, so the lid itself must be bent slightly from who knows. The packaging was fine. Issue prior to packing??

UPDATE #2:  3rd freezer arrived without damage.  Still a small gap in seal on backside of lid.  We lowered/tightened the lid hinge on one side a little bit, and that seemed to take care of it.  It's running quietly, more-so than the 2nd freezer which makes it suspect even more.  Glad I returned it

Photos below are from first freezer.

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White
Review_Title: Not as efficient as a chest freezer, but ...
Review_Text:
This freezer does the job reasonably well - it doesn't get things down to 0 degrees farenheit, but it gets close and that's good enough for my purposes.  Things are very safely frozen in this thing.  It also isn't very noisy, though you can tell when the compressor kick in.

One thing to note is that the shelves are not removable (without disconnecting the "quick freeze" mechanism, which I'm not sure you can and which I don't think they'd recommend) or adjustable.

Also, keep in mind this is not a freezer for storing items you want to get to regularly (e.g. don't put ice pops in there on a hot summer day and go running in to retrieve one every few minutes).  This is a freezer designed for storing food, not regularly accessing it.  It will frost over quickly if you open and close the door a lot and defrosting it means emptying it and letting the ice melt and cleaning up the water.  It doesn't have a drain.

I would have preferred a chest freezer since it would have been less expensive, easier to defrost, and more efficient, but I needed something for a space that wouldn't allow me to have an open top and this Danby does the trick.  If you can fit a chest freezer in your space and don't have a reason for needing an upright, then get one, but if a chest freezer isn't an option, this is a great choice.

All-in-all, I'm very happy with this freezer.  I could have paid a lot more and gotten a better freezer, but this suited my needs.

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White
Review_Title: Great freezer, perfect for our needs.
Review_Text:
We bought the Danby compact chest freezer last month, and I love it!  It is very lightweight, and I could easily help my husband lift it up the eight steps to our kitchen door.  There are even two wheels on the back to help move it.  There is also a power indicator light and a drain plug near the bottom.  The inside volume of 7.1 cubic feet is the perfect size for two adults and two teenagers.  It is small enough to fit into the pantry space between our kitchen and dining room, saving me a trip to the basement every time I need something from it.

The start-up instructions in the manual said to run the freezer at its coldest setting for 3-4 hours when we first plugged it in.  It was cold enough after two.  This is a very quiet appliance. I can hardly hear it running!

This freezer has already paid for itself when I consider the money it has saved us.  Shopping and meal planning is no longer limited by the small freezer above the refrigerator.  I buy ingredients in bulk, and this freezer can handle it.  I never have to worry again about bugs ruining a 50 lb bag of flour.  When I buy cases of fresh produce from the farmers market, I can bring it home, wash it, cut it, and freeze it so that it is ready to cook on a busy weeknight.  With all that, I can still prep freezer meals weeks in advance.

To monitor the temperature more closely, I do wish it came with a separate thermometer to clip onto one of the wire baskets inside.  I don't mind buying one, but it would have been a good idea to include one.

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White
Review_Title: Good for hid... I mean freezing body sized objects
Review_Text:
This freezer is perfect for socking away troublesome meats and veggies that don't know how to pay up on time. If you've tried everything you can think of to get your money out of all your fresh meat and veggies, it might be time to start putting them on ice. And wouldn't you know it, this ice box is perfect size for keeping them from rotting away in a basement and eventually attracting unwanted attention from neighboring meats and veggies! This bad boy can only fit one regular sized meat and/ or veggie. No need to buy a second for witnessing meats and veggies too.

Pros:
-surprisingly deep!
-relatively energy efficient. I have no noticeable increase in utilities since buying this freezer. This also happened to coincide with a roommate moving out though, so make your own assumptions on energy usage.
-can fit one whole person in there, at least. If you were so inclined. Which I'm not.
-gauranteed not to rat you out to the 5-0.
-comes with a basket for bread items!

Cons:
-theoretical body would need to be cut into smaller pieces.
-appliance does not congratulate me after Tetris-ing the hell out of whatever I'm jamming in there. Surprisingly hurtful.

I am super pleased with this item's performance. I'd be inclined to give 5 stars were it not for the temperature control being low to the ground, which caused my immediate death. Still a solid 4 stars.

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White

But, after using it for a month or so, I am seeing ice forming inside next to the door seal so the seal must be leaking a bit - not good.

Also I was surprised/disappointed to see that it is not designed to operate in an unheated space (below 32) - heck, this is what garages are for.  So I purchased an electronic temperature controller ($15) and am going to wrap the compressor with a heating pad and see if it works this winter.  (Has anyone tried this?)

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White
Review_Text: First, if you're considering this freezer, read the bad reviews first. They're right! I would give this Danby Freezer a 0 if I could. First, this freezer had a small ding on the lower right side right out of the box. But, it was something I was ready to look past. I followed the directions which were easy and straight to the point to get this freezer ready. The problem was, it didn't freeze! I had it set to the coldest setting and it didn't freeze at all. Had it plugged in and on at the coldest setting for 3 days and still didn't freeze! It didn't even get that cold. I put a few frozen food items in it and it thawed right inside this freezer. Thinking perhaps it was the outlet, I tried a different outlet, the same outlet my Samsung Fridge is plugged into and it still didn't freeze properly after having it set to the coldest setting for 6 hours. I'm returning this freezer and going with a completely different brand. Stay away from this Danby freezer folks you can do better. You've been warned.

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White
Review_Title: Heads up - get serial number off back
Review_Text:
Yesterday, a friend unpacked and set up my new freezer on a sturdy stand, positioning it the requisite five inches from the wall. This morning, I started to register it for warranty purposes, only to find that the serial number required for the registration is on the back of the unit.  I tried a mirror and taking a cell phone pic, to no avail - had to get help and move the freezer away from the wall to see the serial number. This is just a heads up to get the serial number off the back as soon as you unpack it!  Packaging was good.  I just finished washing inside and have not yet plugged it in - will update this review after I've used it for a while.

Another tip - so far, the best way that I've found to open the door is to push up on the underside of the freezer top while grasping the groove at the top of the door.

Product_Name: Danby DUFM032A1WDB 3.2 Cubic Feet Upright Freezer, White
Review_Title: Your basic, no frills freezer workhorse from a reputable company
Review_Text:
Bought this 3 months ago to hold my beer brewing supplies, frozen fruit, etc and basically get my junk out of the family freezer.  This freezer is COMPACT, with a smaller footprint than a half-sized dorm fridge. It opens using a to lid (chest type freezer). It is very light and can be easily lifted up stairs. It's so quiet I don't notice it often (it's in a basement play room),

I just wanted something functional, and this is it.  I've toyed getting a second one to modify into a "kegerator", as it would hold two torpedo type kegs easily (if need bem it's easy to add height to a chest freezer using an insulated wooden collar).

UPDATE: After running for a year, it's still fine, and very quiet. There's a little bit of frost on the inside (1/4 inch or a few mm), but not a problem.

Review_Title: Happy with this freezer so far
Review_Text: Happy with this freezer so far. Of course, it's only been one day. My Kenmore that I had for 12 years finally quit. This freezer only has half the capacity as my old one, but still has plenty of room for all our bulk frozen items, which basically means I've been wasting both space and energy for the last 12 years. Good times. Anyway, I like this freezer. It arrived with no visible damage, and the material both inside and out feels durable. Hopefully it'll do its job for several years. If it lasts at least half as long as my old one, I'll feel like I got my money's worth.

Review_Title: Cold enough to freeze vodka solid.
Review_Text:
I was looking for a small chest freezer to fit in my apartment, mostly to keep a handy supply of ice and a few frozen treats. There had been a bit of shipping damage and I wanted to make sure it worked after it was set up and rested. I plugged it in with a bag of ice and some vodka and left it overnight set to not-quite-max cold.

This evening when I came home, I discovered that the vodka was frozen stiff. I've never seen that before, and I live in Minnesota.

It's quiet. I have to get down to listen if it's running.

I'm not all that pleased with the all-white exterior, but I'm pretty sure that's easily fixed with some creativity.

Overall, I am pleased.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Text: Arrived on time. Followed directions re: letting it sit for an hour or so before plugging it in and turning it on. It's been churning out ice ever since. We are very pleased with this purchase.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: Otherwise this machine does an excellent job making ice
Review_Text: The only issue with this device is that sometimes low water sensor doesn't go on--or it goes on then off before I see it. I do leave it on for a while. Otherwise this machine does an excellent job making ice. The settings Large, medium, small have to do with the thickness of the cubes (hollow in center), not the length of the cubes. Ice comes out frosty but once in a glass, the ice is crystal clear. I love the cubes as do my dogs. They are easy to crunch. I think they make my drink cooler than the larger, chunky cubes my refrig used to make. I bought this to replace that ice maker. The disadvantage is that you have to pour water into the machine and drain it if not using it. The advantage is that you can fill it with whatever water you want: soft, hard, distilled, etc. Buy an ice maker you can drain so that it remains sanitary.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: Produces good amount of ice for our needs
Review_Text: We use ours almost nonstop in summer. Produces good amount of ice for our needs. When basket is full, just put in baggie, in freezer and use when needed.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: Even my husband was tickled I purchased this ice maker!!
Review_Text: This portable ice maker works Great! At first, I thought it was slow but after everything got really cold, it was steadily dumping out the ice cubes. The only cautionary remark I would add to my review is for a buyer to recognize exactly what this is & its limitations. It is not the high price, installed ice machine. It is portable. It is well insulated but it is will not hold the ice cubes indefinitely. The ice cubes will melt. My suggestion would be to start a day or two ahead of an event to bag this ice as it makes!  I had a house full of 17 or so family members. This augmented my fridge ice maker nicely! I used regular tap water. But I do think the next time I use it, I will use purified water to see if the ice cubes will be clear!

Review_Text: Dead on arrival. Would not make ice. Let it sit for 24 hours and again no ice. Maybe I just got the lucky one?

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: I am in love with this counter top ice machine
Review_Text:
I am in love with this counter top ice machine.  My refrigerator is 20 years old and the ice machine broke.  So I got this just in time. I hate having to fill and empty ice cube trays.

The ice machine is a little bigger than a bread baking machine and weighs 25 pounds. It has a modern stainless steel body and a black top with a see thru window.

It's so easy to use and came with an instruction manual.  You just plug-in and add water. The machines works on its on.  There is an electronic control panel on the front with LED light indicators.  There are metal rods looks like 9 that create the ice.  The basket holds 2.2 pounds of ice.  The machine let's you know when the water is low or the basket is full with the LED lights.

It is very quiet and the only noise I heard was ice falling in the basket.

When I first started it took about 15 minutes to make about 9 medium pieces of ice.  To be honest I though of my gosh it's gonna take a couple days to fill this ice basket at this rate.  After the first batch of ice it started making ice about every 9 minutes.  I noticed after about 2 hours that the basket was almost full.  We made several baskets of ice that day and have been making lots of ice ever since.

I prefer the larger size ice cubes which are not as big as ice cubes in an ice tray but work good in my diet soda and ice tea glasses.  The small size would be great for slushes in the blender.

I like having the window on top so you can see the ice.  Should I get busy and forget to empty the basket,  the ice just melts back into water in the reservoir.

To change the size of the ice just requires a push of a button for small, medium or large.  There is also a power button to turn on and off.

It has a drain plug to empty unused water since it says to use fresh water every 24 hrs.

This is definitely one of my favorite new kitchen gadgets.  My daughter has already asked to borrow it.

It also has a 12 month warranty which is great.

I did receive this product free in exchange for an honest and unbiased opinion.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: Very nice ice maker! Easy to use and works awesome! Seriously!
Review_Text:
I love this ice maker. Omg. I love ice. I put ice in almost every drink. I love ice water. I love chewing on ice. But ice trays suck. So I was super excited to get this. It's very sleek looking too. It's pretty heavy, and has a fan on the side and air holes in the back so you have to keep it away from stuff so it can work properly. When I first got it, it said to let sit for an hour to settle so I did. Then I filled it almost to the line with water and turned it on. I selected medium ice cubes because it said they could possibly stick if you used larger ones. Then let it do its thing. About 10 or so maybe 15 minutes later, I heard ice fall into the tray. I went and looked and was so excited. I had ice!
So when you open the flip top lid, you will see a scoop inside a basket. Lift that out and that's where you put the water. In the back behind the basket were some metal rods. That is what the ice is formed around. I know because I watched it a couple times lol.
When I first got it, I cleaned the inside as directed with a soapy wash cloth then dried it.
The front of it, has a few buttons. One for on/off, and one for selecting the ice cube size. It also has an indicator to let you know when the ice basket is full and when you need more water. How freaking awesome.
I now have 2 huge bowls of ice in my freezer! It makes so much ice. I love it. Now I can have ice anytime I want, for free. I don't have to pay. The ice that I have in my freezer, fills my little cooler perfectly. Yay. We are having a BBQ this weekend and guess who's bringing the ice.
This is probably my most favorite kitchen appliance ever now. I definitely recommend. Very user friendly and easy to set up and use. Great ice too!
I did get to try this free but these are my own opinions and experiences.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: Solid ice producer, even better customer service
Review_Text: We've had this ice maker for one year - just over, technically (purchased 08/17). Since we first plugged it in, it's been a workhorse and we've had it plugged in and on almost every day. Works exactly as advertised: 3 ice sizes, enough ice for a drink in one cycle (~7 min) and for a big-boy smoothie in two cycles (less than 15 min). You can hear it drop ice into the bucket, but it's not too disruptive where it sits on our downstairs bar just under the kitchen; we leave it on continuously, although we do turn it off when guests are sleeping in the next room (separated by glass doors). Ice isn't overly wet and drippy - it's restaurant quality or better, firm, perfectly formed, and not frozen into a big block. We do need to 'dry' or drain the ice on a paper towel before dumping it into a ziploc bag if we want to transfer to the freezer or it'll clump up, but it's not a big nuisance and we typically just leave it in the machine to melt/refreeze for fresh cubes. For it's performance it's a solid four stars - could be quieter, could make more per cycle, could store better, but overall great. ThinkGizmos customer service pushes this to a firm five stars, though: Yesterday our ice maker went out - no explanation, no warning, just woke up and no ice for smoothies; played with it most of the day and got nowhere so I emailed customer service through amazon. By this morning they had emailed me back offering to send a replacement and apologizing for the inconvenience. We're a little out of the warranty window so I emailed figuring maybe they could advise on repair and am truly impressed by their level of service and responsiveness. Items break down, especially after warranty windows, and especially with ultra-heavy daily use. I get that. And apparently so does ThinkGizmos. A- for the ice maker (great, but broken after 1 year of heavy use), and A++ for ThinkGizmos as a seller.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Text: I have had this ice maker for over a year now and its still going strong. No problems, no issues and it makes all the ice I want it to. This little guy works hard to produce ice for me constantly since our refrigerator ice maker took a dump over a year ago... I love this machine and I highly recommend!!!

It's quiet enough for during the day, so I can let it run while I'm doing housework, etc. It does make too much noise for watching tv with, as you hear the ice dropping. It would be great in an RV or anywhere you had electricity. It takes a little while to get going well---the first batch isn't too impressive. But it gets the job done. This is a replacement for one that we had for several years, that worked great, also. I tried a different brand first, and the noise was horrible---I had to send it back. This one is great.

Review_Text: Our fridge doesn't have an ice maker so I bought this and it works great.  You do have to plan before hand about your ice...it takes several hours to make ice...so start it at night and in the morning you will have some ice....then depending if that is all you want you will need to add more water to get more ice...I usually put the ice in a gallon bag and throw that in the freezer for when I need it. For big parties...it would be faster to just buy a bag of ice from the store. Perfect for a family usage but not parties unless you don't need ice very quickly.

The phone number in the instruction booklet is in the UK. I bought this as a Christmas present for my husband and couldn't be more disappointed.
Since I last wrote this review, the company contacted me and sent a new machine. So far, it is working as it should. The prior machine, when it was working, did not produce ice very quickly at all. This new one is keeping up much faster. Hoping for the best. Thank you for sending a replacement.

Review_Text: When I received this machine it was well packaged. The instructions were clear on how to set the machine up and operate it.  I followed the instructions to wait one hour before plugging the machine in to allow the refrigerant time to settle.  Once I cleaned, filled, and started the machine, it was making Ice within 10 minutes. Since then, it has been making Ice that is a nice shape and size.  It has made plenty of Ice in the short time I have had it in operation.  I would recommend this machine again to anyone. It out performs the ice maker in my home refrigerator by a long shot.

I purchased this product because the water line going to our refrigerator started to leak and, although we have attempted numerous times to have it fixed, it still leaks.  Thankfully I found this product that works great! Review_Title: Good when working, mine broke quickly and easily.
Review_Text:
Mine lasted about a week before water sensor flamed out. Now it doesn't register when the tank has water so it won't make ice. there's very little useful troubleshooting information on this product--including from the manufacturer--so I have no idea how to fix it other than maybe taking it completely apart.

Piece of (insert epithet here).

It's a shame, though, when it was working, it was pretty good. But I'm pretty sure I paid for longer than a week's performance and I can say I didn't stress it very much. I never filled the tank to max and never used all of the water in the tank. I also never let the ice inside build up to maximum. So it's not like I pushed it to its limit. It just sucked.

Review_Title: Best purchase I think I have ever made.
Review_Text:
This might just be the best thing I ever purchased. Honestly, having ice all the time at my fingertips with ease, yeah it's that good.
Because of my refrigerator's placement its not feasible to run a line to its ice maker so ice would either have to be purchased in a bag, or you go without, but not now, not ever going forward as this thing is amazing. It takes about 6 minutes or so to crank out ice.

Because of how its designed, it just constantly tries to make ice if water is available. If you are not using the ice, it melts back into the reservoir and this allows more ice to be made. It's genius. I wish I could give it a higher score it's that good.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: I would have given it 4 stars for its performance but I found the output in the description some-what mis-leading.
Review_Text:
GENERAL COMMENTS:
Let me begin by saying that if you don't use more than 4-6 standard size trays of ice /day then this machine is probably not worth it for you. No ice-machine I've seen is even a close 2nd to the ice-makers that are available in most refrigerators these days in as far as production, ease of use, convenience and quality of ice so if you have the option of purchasing or using a refrigerator with an ice-maker by all means take that option. This ice machine definitely has a learning curve and is not as turn-key as I thought, however, there are a few simple tricks you can do that will enhance it's performance and output. I would have given it 4 stars for its performance but I found the output in the description some-what deceiving. Another consideration that you will have to make is the counter space that the machine takes up.

OPERATION:
The machine produces the 1st batch of 9 bullet shaped cubes (which are 1/2+ the volume of traditional cubes) in about 6 minutes as described but succeeding batches take considerably longer. It takes from 3 to 3.5 hours to fill the hopper which is 9.5"x 5"x 4.5". The description states that the machines produces 26 lbs./day but that's if you operate it for 24 hours. When the ice comes out it is wet and it will stick together after it is put into the freezer the same as the bags of ice you buy from Walmart, C-stores, etc. The difference is that ice from these locations is made from tap water and could possibly have sanitary issues depending on how it was bagged. This machine gives you the control of sanitary handling and the option of using spring or purified water.

A few operating tips to enhance performance:
1.) When the hopper fills up, the full ice indicator light comes on and halts machine operation even after the hopper is emptied until the sensor warms up. If you desire the machine to keep operating, cover the sensor (a metal rod on the right side of the hopper) with the ice scoop, handle pointing up. If you forget, hold the sensor between your fingers until it warms up and the red indicator light goes off.
2.) Put some left over ice into the reservoir to speed up the process.
3.) Store the ice in a small bucket/container lined with a bag, that way you can pull the bag out and bang it on the counter if the cubes freeze together and then easily put them back in the bucket.

I hope this review will help you to make an informed decision about whether or not this machine is right for you.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: Not like my old Magic Chef
Review_Text: This is very slow at making ice. Not like my old Magic Chef. Unfortunately, the latter was not listed when I wanted to buy a new ice maker, but you sent me an email offering one the day after I bought this machine. It also cost $70 more than the Magic Chef. Shipping was also delayed by a week from the original promised date. Way to foment buyer's remorse!! This one does not work as well as the Magic Chef. It also often doesn't turn on again once the red button is lit to say it's full. Even when you empty the basket. You have to unplug it and restart it. All in all, not happy with purchase.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: This is a good product. Solidly built
Review_Text: This is a good product. Solidly built, and works very well. It will make ice fast. My only issues are; it is quite larger than you may think, the ice will melt if not removed quickly... so, if you run it you'll be dumping ice every 15 minutes or so. All in all, a very good machine.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Text:
This is a handsome little beverage ice maker that does a fine job of making small batches of ice quickly.  It fits in well with all our other stainless steel appliances, and sits on the wet bar nicely, without taking up too much room.  I almost took off a star because the otherwise handy plastic ice scoop that comes with it has no good resting place.  We improvised and drilled a small hole in the handle, placing a magnetic hook on the side of the machine, where the scoop now hangs.  It's a nice workaround, but probably should have been included with the unit.

I don't see much use for the small or medium ice settings, as those ice bullets are quite small, and easily melt away, due to the nature of the shape and temperature of this ice.  But, the large bullets work really well for beverages.

I would not recommend this ice maker for applications where you need hard, crystallized ice, such as icing down an injury.  You'll want harder, more substantial ice for that.  But, for drinks, and at the reasonable sales price, this thing is just what the doctor ordered!

Review_Title: Worked great for about 4 months then all of a sudden ...
Review_Text: Bought this in Feb 2016 for our Motorhome. Worked great for about 4 months then all of a sudden in mid-July doesn't work. Red light kept coming on & saying the ice tray was full. There was no ice at all. We tried everything to make it work again. Used real cold water. Less water. More water. Cleaned it again and on and on. Nothing. Called Amazon and told them we wanted a refund. They said fine and told us to set it on our porch and they'll have UPS come and get it and they'll issue a refund. I told them we don't have a porch...we're traveling in our Motorhome. After a couple of minutes talking to this person in India they finally spoke with one of their supervisors and said they'd make an exception this time. They refunded a $166 and said to disregard the emailed UPS pickup notice. We then threw the unit in the trash can went to Walmart and bought one of their $89 units and works fine so far.

Amazon had nothing to do with how it was packed at the manufacturer.  Needless to say, this one didn't work, either.  I have sent back 2 ice makers in the past 3 days.  If anyone knows of one that REALLY DOES WORK, please answer this post.  I strongly would discourage anyone from buying this ice machine.  It is a piece of garbage.

Review_Text:
UPATE:  So I hate changing my reviews from good to bad.  But after less then one year of owning this ice machine it is dead.  Will make no ice at all.  The fan and condenser run and run and nothing.  Sad this did start off as a good product as you see from my review when I received it but NOW it sits in Garage broken.  SAD many products fail so quickly anymore!!!
Disappointed to say the lease

So I have been looking for a table top ice maker for awhile.  And well reviews were good for this with some hiccups.  But after a couple weeks I will have to say this is a 5 star product so far.  It came in a double box to protect it.  So the package was in perfect condition.  The machine its self looks very nice.  You do have to add water into the bottom well and no, there is no freezer that keeps ice cold.  There is also a drain line, but I think besides to empty and clean you really do not need to mess with it.

The machine started right up,  It is very quiet and we have it set on medium size cubs and does make them in.... say 7 to 10 minutes per cycle.  Maybe the small ice cubes come out quicker but we like middle size.  If you leave the ice, yes it will melt, yes it will stick together, but take the scoop they give you and they break right apart to scoop out.

To add there was no plastic taste what so ever for us.  inside was wrapped and clean, we did wipe it out with soapy water and turned it on.  So far great machine, good ice, quiet and looks good.

Review_Text: This device is terrific!  When you first fill it with water, it takes about 20 minutes or so for a couple of cycles to really get a decent amount of ice.  After that, it cranks out ice every 10 minutes or less and keeps up with 4 adults enjoying various beverages all afternoon and evening.  When the ice melts, the water goes back into the reservoir and it makes more ice!  How cool is that?  It is a little on the loud side but not so annoying that you notice it all the time.  Highly recommended!

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Text: I initially bought this for use in our new pop-up camper. I wanted to try it out before we used it on the road so I filled it with water, put it on the counter and plugged it in. Wow! what a surprise. Works like a champ. Filled it with spring water, now no bad taste (chlorine) in drinks. Ice tastes fresh and no lingering refrigerator odors. The first set of cubes is a little smaller than the rest. The machine just keeps kicking them out till the basket is full. The ice at the bottom of the basket will stick together but is easily broken up and easy to put in glasses or in a water bottle. The little metal pin in the right that the basket hangs on turns off the ice production when the basket is full. If you want to restart the ice faster move the ice off the pin and just hold your fingers on the pin for a few seconds and then the machine is kicking them out again. I have to say that this ranks as one of my best purchases in a long time and I could not be happier with the product. Should have bought one sooner!

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Text:
It just doesn't make ice fast enough for me. 10 small cubes every 15 minutes or 10 large cubes every 25 minutes. It has yet to make the 22lbs in 24hours that it promised. For all the hassle I would have rather kept buying bags of ice.

However it is working and is producing ice.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Text: After reading so many reviews stating these ice makers keep you in plenty of ice for entertaining, I bought one for a ladies luncheon I host every year.  I have only one (relatively) small refrigerator and when preparing for guests, the fridge & freezer space is at a premium.  I thought this unit may alleviate having to make room in the freezer for purchased ice.  Once I received it, I gave it a test run.  Turns out it takes ~four hours for the bin to get full.  (This was confirmed in another review here.)  Ok, fine.  It's easy enough to start it up four hours ahead of when I need it.  BUT...once the bin is full, it only takes a few people who want a lot of ice in smallish glasses (~8 oz) to pretty much empty the bin... So for *MY* purposes, this was not helpful & I have returned the unit.  I would say that if need a smallish amount of ice throughout the day or evening and don't mind donating the space (this is a BIG unit), this ice maker would be great.  But (IMO/IME), don't count on this to keep you flowing in ice for a somewhat large gathering.  Oh and yes, it does make noise when dumping the ice.  Just like a regular ice maker does.  (Some reviews were complaining about the noise.)

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Text: good

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: Perfect Ice Maker - I'm using it 24/7
Review_Text: After doing research for a ice maker for over a week, the ThinkGizmos had the most positive reviews so I ordered it and it's working perfectly.  My husband is a union carpenter and he takes 2-3 10 pounds bags of ice to work every day in the summer.  So we never had ice in the frigid which is why I needed a portable ice maker.  Now I get 2 1/2 10lb bags of ice a day which is perfect.  It quiet & fills the tray with larger ice in 1 1/2 hours. We keep it in the laundry room out of the way since it a little to big to go under our kitchen cabinets when it's being used (with the lid open its 24 inches tall).  So far I've been running it for 5 days straight all day all night.  I also have not had a problem with my ice freezing together.  To stop that from happening before I dump the ice into the ice bags I pour out all the excess water in the tray and put it in the freezer.  Perfect ice cubes!  If is does freeze together I drop the ice bags on the floor once and it brakes apart easily.  I also brought the 10lb ice bags to store the ice in.  All I can say is Perfect!

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Text: not 1 problem and we use this 3 times a week.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: Doesn't hold a lot of ice before it says it is full.
Review_Text:
I had a hard time, wondering if it should be 3 or 4 stars.  I settled on 3 because my issue was that big of a deal to me.  My issue?  The basket only  fills half way with ice.  The placement of the sensor is in a spot where it registers the ice is full, when it is only half full, which is not very much ice.  We use our ice maker for parties, and three drinks can wipe out the amount of ice it has when it says it is full.  Not cool!  (no pun intended)

I really like the size of the ice (we use the large).  I like that it has a drain on the side to drain the old water for ease of cleaning.  It holds more water, which is nice.  I would really like the larger size if it actually held more ice.  We previously had two Igloo ice makers and the baskets would get completely full, but was much smaller in size.

I've only had it for a day, so this is just my initial thoughts.  I will come back and review if anything changes (good or bad) in the coming weeks.

Would I buy it again?  Well, if I could find one that held more ice... no way.  Slightly disappointed, but happy to have any ice at all.

Update: Worked great for 11 months before the motor broke and couldn't lift the ice. No problem since this has a one year warranty, right?  Except the only way to contact the company on their US site is through a web form that gets an error when you try to submit.  I can't find any replacement parts for it so now I've got a large paperweight.  Changed from 3 stars to 1 star.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: PLEASE READ BEFORE PURCHASING THIS PRODUCT! -
Review_Text: I bought this unit in May of 2017. I have used it approximately 10 times to make 10 - 10 lb bags of ice. I store the unit when not in use and have taken extreme care not to bang, bump, turn on its side , etc and treated this thing with kit gloves. I tried to make my 11th - 10 lb bag of ice today and the unit continues to flash 'Add Water' even though the the water is filled to the Max water line.  While it worked I found the product to be extremely well made and proficient. However after 8 months and more importantly after 10, thats (TEN) uses it no longer works & is very dissapointing and maddening. I have tried to contact the manufactorer and there is no phone number for them. I had to email a request (only way to communicate with them) for the manufactores warranty information to determine if my unit is still covered. Of course you guessed it, to date NO response and I am stuck with a $149 metal box thats too big for even a paper weight......  My Advise is to select another unit and company that stands behind their product and better yet has an actual call center that can be reached.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: First it worked, then it didn't!
Review_Text: I received this ice maker in March and couldn't have been happier.  The first time I used it, it cranked out 5-6 gallon ziplock bags of ice  in a very short period of time.  Fast forward to May 25.  This was the second time I used it, and it was a completely different  experience.  I  had planned to bag and store ice for the Memorial Holiday weekend.  I turned the machine on and some 5 hours later, I had a scant 1 gallon ziplock bag of ice.  What a shock and disappointment!  I checked the "trouble shooting" section of the user manual that came with the unit, and  couldn't find an explanation for my problem.  I attempted to call the manufacturer's customer service line, and was unable to get through with  the phone number provided.  I then called Amazon to see what my options were.  Thankfully, Amazon takes excellent care of the customer, and I was  issued an immediate full refund!  Although I still need a portable ice maker for extra ice this summer, I will not reorder this one. Even though many customer reviews for this ice maker were favorable, I cannot give it a good rating.  It failed on the second use.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Text:
My refrigerator is not near a water line so making ice must be done with ice cube trays or an ice making machine.  This ice machine reliably cranks out ice for home use.  By no means is this made for commercial use but to fill several glasses of ice for a meal, with more left over, it's great.  I have only used the small setting which seems to fit glasses well.  Of course, you can always bag ice ahead of time and keep it in your freezer for occassions where you'll need a several bags.  The chamber where the ice is kept is insulated but not refrigerated so the ice will eventually melt.  However the water reservoir is below the vented ice basket so the water simply refreezes into more ice.  It comes with a perfectly usable white plastic scoop but I bought a metal scoop because I liked the design.

Pros:
Preforms as advertised.
Quiet except for the occasional sound of ice dropping in the basket.

Cons:
This unit is fairly big and takes up a good bit of kitchen counter real-estate.
While fine for my use, and I would guess most households, it may not produce enough ice for some.
I wish the price were a little lower.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: Pretty big footprint, but can crank out a lot of ice
Review_Text:
Good ice machine overall.  Makes a lot of ice quickly, and so far it works very well.  Operation is easy:  plug it in, pour in some water, and hit the button.  It'll start dumping small loads of ice in about 15 minutes, and will fill its reservoir within a couple of hours.

This thing has a pretty large footprint, so take note of the dimensions and make sure that it can fit comfortably on your counter top.

I think that the downfall of this machine and others like it is that it isn't refrigerated.  So any ice that it drops into the tray immediately starts melting.  This is problematic if you're wanting to save up the ice and put it in the freezer (in bags, or in our case an ice dispenser).  The melty ice just forms a single solid block once it re-freezes.  That's not a problem unique to this machine, but it's definitely my least favorite thing about it.

Review_Text: I don't usually write reviews because what I will say will be a repeat of all the other reviews. That being said; I love this machine. We have had this machine for a three months and it has been running everyday. The biggest thing I will have to note for everyone is the ice is wet ice. I read previous reviews and the one comment that helped the most was, put the ice from the basket in a zip lock bag and put it in the freezer. The ice will freeze together making it difficult to break apart. Putting it in a bag every batch makes it easier to break up and put into a bucket for storage or use. The noise level is louder than a refrigerator, but it doesn't bother us at all.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Text:
This is my second ice maker that is exactly the same. If your like me I used this Ice maker everyday for up to a year & then it failed.
You may experience that the tray will rotate back & forward then stop & it is stopped at an angle & will not pour water anymore. After this has happened the green light will blink while the machine is on Signifying that it no longer works. You may also experience the ice tray may crack. Due to excessive back & forth dropping the ice & water pouring in the tray which is normal. It's supposed to do that. Standard wear & tear. As well the rotating metal joints that rotate the tray will get rusted. I took the top off & used WD-40 to spray & lubricate it & it started working again. This all happened to me but be warned. This machine will only last about a year ounce you start using it. That is if you use it everyday. One more thing regardless of the maker the design of this ice maker is the same. I have the second one made by igloo & the first one from a company I can't remember. & yes both of my ice makers have failed. I'm getting another one though.

Review_Title: I'm getting good use but it took some thought to adjust my ...
Review_Text: I'm getting good use but it took some thought to adjust my use to it's ability. I was accustomed to ice makers in refrigerators but this is a sit-alone. I keep it in the garage where the temps are warm. The only freezing area inside is the actual ice tray while the rest is water and ice storage. This means after turning it on the unit starts making ice and dumping into the bin but the ice quickly melts back into the water tank and does so until all the water is close to freezing temp. From then ice lasts long enough to accumulate quickly. If I start the process around 10 AM I can use the ice in a couple of hours. By 5 I've got about a gallon of ice put away in the freezer.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Text:
AMAZING little ice machine! This quiet little machine is one of the best buys I've ever made. It's small size and quiet operation have saved my family tons in bagged ice. It puts out nice semi-hard, "crunchable" ice in mere minutes.
If you're looking for a fast, efficient, quiet, portable, reliable, easy-to-use, icemaker...look no further.
I have not received any sort of discount nor offered any sort of perk for this review. Honestly the best purchase I've made in several years.

*edit* This was a great little ice maker, key word "was". It just died after a little over a year. I don't blame the machine. I didn't have it surge protected and we had a storm that zapped it. I still stand by my 5 star review, but be warned, put this thing on a surge protector. Otherwise, you may be shedding tears over your investment like I am now :(

Review_Text:
Works as advertised.  Ice is a little wet after an hour or so, so I take it out of the ice maker, put in a baggie, then put in freezer. After awhile I break up the ice while still in the baggie then put the ice in the ice tray in the freezer.  I always have a few baggies stored in the freezer.  Works like a charm.  My refrigerator's ice maker broke, $200 later, breaks again. Hope this gizmo lasts.

Updated - does not make ice anymore. Just noise like it is trying but no ice.  Actually stopped working, then after a week or so, I tried it again and it worked.  But then stopped again and this time for good.  Will try to return, it is still under warranty.

Update again - was promptly sent a replacement after I contacted ThinkAwesome. Great customer service.  It's been a few weeks since receiving replacement and machine is working great.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Text: This thing is super loud... way louder than my dishwasher. The ice cubes can be made in 3 sizes; small, medium & large. The large cubes are not very large at all. It DOES make ice cubes relatively quickly, but it does not have a refrigerated holder for the ice. There is simply a basket where the cubes get dumped that is right above the water reservoir. As soon as the cubes are barely frozen, they are dumped into the basket and start to melt. In the 10 minutes it takes for the next small batch of ice to be made, the first batch is nearly melted. It's a constant cycle of freeze & thaw. I even tried dumping the ice into a bag and putting it in my freezer right away. Not only is that a pain in the rear, the cubes just froze together in my freezer because they barely freeze in this "ice machine." Do not waste your money. I'm returning this junk.

My wife, who I got it for,  loves the ease of use and quality (chompability) of the ice.  Glad I chose this ice maker of all the ones I researched.

Review_Text: This product generally had good reviews. I ordered one as a gift. The one received did not work at all. I contacted Amazon, who promptly issued a refund and emailed a postpaid label to return the faulty product. I exercised the "order again" option and received a second one. I tried it out in my home and the new machine seemed to work well. It drops a load of cubes into the basket every 10-15 minutes. When the receiver of the gift took it home, it worked well the first time, then became quirky. When I contacted the manufacturer they offered to replace the machine again. In subsequent uses it works MOST of the time and we are seeing if it will "settle in."  Meanwhile, I did buy the extended 3-year warranty and will expect the machine to work consistently for three years. This may or may not be a long three years.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Text: I read all the reviews, and it isn't quiet, but it also doesn't bother me. The fan seems to get a little louder the longer you run it, at least the first day, but we are putting it in a closet and it shouldn't be a problem. It takes about 4-5 hours to get a gallon bag of ice. It seemed to get quicker the more we used it. We love the ice however. My husband didn't like it setting on the counter, thought it was too bulky and was reluctant to keep at first. But I found a great place for it in our closet and he really liked having the ice on hand with such a small amount that our refrigerator makes. If you can't do a built in, this is a good solution. Word of caution, however, the very tiny white plug for the drain got lost after the second day. I didn't tell my husband about it specifically and he didn't realize there was another piece before screwing the cap on. Gone. I wrote to amazon asking to purchase several of these for future losses and got a reply within 48 hours. They contacted the company, which is in UK, and they are shipping extra plugs to me. Very satisfied and anxiously waiting for them to arrive so we can use it again. I miss not having it only after a couple of days.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: Fast ice in a very nice package.
Review_Text:
Form.
Like other ice makers in this category, this machine requires a fair bit of counter space at about an 18" square footprint, with needed space to the left of the machine for the exhaust fan.  We use this in a travel trailer, and the cabinet gets a bit crowded.
The exhaust hasn't caused any problems heating up the trailer space.
The stainless cabinet is attractive (even if it doesn't match the decor, lol),  and the display is easy to see and understand.
At around 25 lbs, it is heavy enough to stay put on the cabinet while traveling.  The cord is long enough to give you options on where to plug it in.

Fit.
The lid feels more solid than on a previous unit we had, and the tray fits well.  The cabinet is well-made.  (Not a lot to comment on, here.)

Function,
This is my second ice machine.  The other one, from a different maker, failed after a year.
This one is fantastic.  We had ice in mere minutes, and the tray was full in about an hour.
The features on this are limited, but that's a good thing.  The last one had a timer, settable start and stop times, an LCD display and a bunch of other unnecessary and, frankly, annoying crap on it.  Beeped all the damn time.  2 AM seemed to be a favorite.
This one just makes ice in, supposedly 3 different sizes.  It has lights for "Low Water" and "Full of Ice", and for cube size.  OK, "Tube" would be more appropriate than "cube", but you get the idea.
In the matter of ice size, I really couldn't tell the difference between the settings.  I guess it could matter if you had a small container to put it in, but we're using it for ice water in 30 oz tumblers, so...
If you are planning to make this ice to bag up and store, this type of ice maker isn't what you want.  The ice it makes is wet, and will form a solid chunk of ice if hard frozen.  The cubes have a tendency to meld together on the machine if left unattended, but it breaks up easily put it in a glass.

I am very satisfied with this purchase, and have already recommended it to a few people.

I was not solicited to write this review (other than the usual Amazon reminder/request) ,and paid full Amazon price for the ice maker.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: Don't expect it to last more than a year or two
Review_Text: the 3rd one of these I purchased just died after a year. The first one lasted several years, started to make A LOT of noise but still worked. I finally got sick of the crazy loud sound and bought #2. It stopped working after about 18 months, this last one I bought only lasted 14 months. I am done, never again. It's not getting any abuse that would cause this lack of performance. These should last a lot longer.

Review_Title: I like the Large ice cube size because it takes longer ...
Review_Text:
This purchase was my solution for deciding not to install an under counter ice maker.  I can bring this portable ice maker out when I need extra ice for parties and put it away the rest of the time.  I like the Large ice cube size because it takes longer to melt in a drink.  It makes about 3 "buckets" of ice for each water filling.  I remove the ice from the bucket when the bucket is full, and put it in the freezer in zip lock bags.

I am very pleased with my purchase.  I decided on this particular unit after reading lots of reviews.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: I've only set it to small, which isn't entirely ...
Review_Text: I've only set it to small, which isn't entirely small - but others have posted pics. It does what it's designed to - makes ice. My partner will only drink water with I've and we rent so fridge ice is gross. It's a bit damp when it comes out so you have to be mindful not to end up with a giant chunk, but definity paid for itself already compared to bags of ice. Has also increased water intake since it's always available.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Text: First, I have to say that this unit was much larger than I expected.  Read the dimensions carefully before buying to make sure your counter height can accommodate.  We ran the unit for a whole day and in the beginning the cubes were small even though I had set it to large.  After running for a few hours, the cubes were the expected size.  It does make a racket when dropping the ice after each batch.  It was loud enough that I could hear during the middle of the night and it is a startling kind of sound.  We had a BBQ gathering and we placed this outside in the patio.  It performed flawlessly and we were never ran out of ice.  This is a great alternative instead of spending thousands on a built in ice maker in the patio.  It is portable, so we have used it indoors or outdoors as the need arises.

Review_Title: ICE ICE ICE and MORE ICE!
Review_Text: We ordered this ice machine for our travel trailer.  I didn't have high hopes of getting buckets full of ice on demand but boy was I surprised!  Within a few hours ice was filling the bucket. I actually had to empty the bucket into freezer bags to keep up with the supply!  One great feature that I LOVE is if the bucket is not emptied, the ice melts and recycles into more ice. I highly recommend this machine!

It is not fast at delivering ice so as long as you are not in a big hurry it is great machine.  I would not be able to use this if I were entertaining and needed a lot of ice.

Product_Name: Ice Machine - Portable, Counter Top Ice Maker Machine TG22 - Produces 26 lbs Of Ice Per 24 Hours - Stainless Steel - Top Rated Ice Maker For Countertop use By ThinkGizmos (trademark protected)
Review_Title: Excellent and Simple to Use ice Maker.
Review_Text: We use the ice maker to supplement our refrigerator ice maker. It is easy to use and makes a basket load of ice in a couple hours. Then we load the cubes in baggies and put them in the freezer. The ice sticks together being wet but if it is left until the bucket is nearly full until transferred then the ice is colder and not wet. The recirculation of melted ice is an essential feature to its ease of use and maintenance.
